Adala is married and has 2 children.  She is 50 years old and is known as a friendly and hardworking farmer.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and prayer group.  Adala has been a farmer for 35 years.  She described her harvest as poor last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  				

Adala first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  She joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices and get new farming methods to enable her to earn enough to feed her family and send her children to school.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader and wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Adala plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and invest in a business.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Adala’s own life was improved because she has more farm training and was able to feed the family.  							

Adala and the Eagles Farmers Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize, millet and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 4 years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Shehnaz is a mother of 4 children and is motivated to provide them with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history. Shehnaz is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Leticia Isabel

texts.es: Leticia tiene 22 años, vive en casa familiar, es soltera.  Estudia contabilidad en un Instituto, para solventar sus gastos trabaja en una empresa de su localidad como asistente contable, también vende ropa a domicilio a sus familiares y amigos. Beneficiaria utilizará el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería (vestidos, polos, blusas, pantalones). Su sueño es culminar su carrera y ser una gran profesional para mejorar la calidad vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Leticia is 20 years old. She lives in her family’s home and is single. She studies accounting at an institute. To pay her expenses she works in a business in her area as an assistant accountant. She also sells clothing to her relatives and friends in their homes. 

The beneficiary will use the loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise (dresses, polo shirts, blouses, pants). Her dream is to finish her studies and be a great professional to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (dresses, blouses, polo shirts, pants).

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 50 years old, a female, and married. She has six(6) children whom she supports. Paulina was introduced to Visionfund Kenya by an officer, and she runs a grocery business which has lasted for three years now. In her business she earns a monthly income of about KES 3,550. 

She is taking her first loan of KES 10,000 which she intends to use to add stock to her business. That includes tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages and mangoes. Paulina will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and her family are to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages and mangoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es:
Julio, disfruta de una vida familiar junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos, de 3, 5 y 7 años de edad, hace mucho tiempo aprendió de un amigo el oficio de estructuras metálicas y también se dedica a la construcción, desde hace 10 años lo hace de forma 9 independiente, hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningún problema en administrar su negocio.
Con el préstamo comprara láminas, tubos, hierro, pintura, etc., estos implementos son parte de las herramientas que necesita para elaborar los trabajos que le encargan sus clientes, espera cumplir con los pedidos en menor tiempo, tener la satisfacción de sus clientes, mejorar su sus ingresos y cancelar deuda.
Sueña con tener un negocio más rentable, cumplir con todos sus compromisos económicos, ofrecer a su familia una mejor alimentación, salud, vestuario y una educación superior a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julio enjoys the family life with his wife and three children, who are 3, 5, and 7 years old. A long time ago, he learned the metal structures trade from a friend, and he also makes a living in construction. For 10 years he has worked independently. Until now he has not had any problems managing his business.

With the loan, he will buy corrugated metal, pipes, iron, paint, etc. These implements are part of the tools that he needs to produce the work that his customers order. He hopes to fill the orders in less time, have his customers’ satisfaction, increase his income, and pay his debt.

He dreams of having a more profitable business, carrying out all of his economic obligations, offering a better diet, health, and clothing to his family, and providing a higher education to his children.

loans.use: to purchase corrugated metal, pipes, iron, paint, etc.

loans.name: Ulker

texts.en:
Ülker is a widow with two children: a daughter in high school and a son in college. Since the death of her husband, she has brought in a small income. She had to work to provide for the needs of her two children.   

From a friend she learned about Amway and began selling Amway products (linens, kitchen appliances, cosmetics and detergent). Her neighbors, relatives and friends became her customers. Since she knew a lot of people, making sales wasn’t a problem. Later, she sold products from other companies the same way. 

With her loan from Maya, she will order products to sell to her clients. When she applied for the loan, she already had customers waiting to order.  Because she sells from catalogs, she took orders from customers without the products on hand and ordered them wholesale. When she has the money in advance, she can order the products from the company at a discount. This way her profits are greater.  

She wants to continue doing this work as long as she is in good health. When she meets friends and neighbors, she can show them the products in the catalogs easily. She has the items they order shipped to her home and then delivers them to her clients. This type of work has advantages for Ülker, who also has time to spend on her home and children. 

Because Ülker wasn’t able to study, she wants her children to stay in school and she wants to give them a better life. Her son is currently enrolled in college and his goal is to study four more years. She wants her daughter to qualify for university, study and have a profession.  

Ülker is a determined woman and skillful at working and selling.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Ülker Hanım,dul ve 2 çocuğu var.  Kızı lisede,oğlu da yüksekokulda okuyor.  Eşi öldükten sonra kendisine az bir maaş bağlanmış.  İki çocuğu olduğundan  ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak zorunda ve çalışmalıydı.  Arkadaşında gördü ve  amway(çamaşır,mutfak gereçleri,kozmetik ürünler,deterjan) ürünleri satmaya başladı.  Çevresindeki komşuları,akrabaları,arkadaşları müşterileri oldu.  Çevresi çok olduğundan satış yapmakta zorluk çekmedi.  Daha sonra çeşitli firmaların ürünlerini aynı şekilde sattı.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile ürün siparişi alıp müşterilerine satacak.  Krediye müracaat ettiğinde ,sipariş bekleyen müşterileri vardı .  Katologtan satış yaptığı için, ürün elinde olmasa da müşterilerden sipariş alıyor ve bu siparişleri firmadan toplu istek yaparak satış yapıyor.  Elinde toplu para olduğunda, ürünleri firmadan indirimli olarak daha avantajlı bir şekilde alıyor.  Böyle olunca karı daha çok oluyor.  Gelecekte bu işi sağlığı el verdikçe yapmak istiyor.  Çünkü katologtan sattığı için ,gittiği arkadaş toplantılarında,komşularına ürünü rahatlıkla gösterebiliyor.  Aldığı ürünler  kargo ile evine geliyor.  Sonra müşterilerine teslim ediyor.  Ülker Hanım  için avantajlı bir iş ,hem evine hem çocuklarına vakit ayırabiliyor.  Ülker Hanım okumadığından,çocukları okusun hayatlarını kurtarsınlar istiyor.  Oğlu şu an da yüksek okulda ,hedefi dört yıllık daha okumak.  Kızı  lisede üniversiteyi kazanıp ,okusun mesleği olsun istiyor.  Azimli,iş yapma ve satma becerisine sahip.

loans.use: to buy products to resell.

loans.name: Caro's Group

texts.en:
Caro is a member of Inuka Group in Chwele District. She is pictured here in a group of three One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 39 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Caro has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Caro is 38 years old and has been a farmer for 20 years. Caro works as a farmer to provide for her five children. The community and other farmers know Caro as reliable and hardworking. Other than farming, she is also involved in community activities such as the women's group and the prayer group.  Caro described her harvest last year as excellent, but she hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.
														
Caro first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Caro joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, new farming methods and fertilizer and hybrid seeds. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader and wants to help more farmers. 

Caro plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Caro’s own life was improved because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm group support and is able to feed the family.  
							
Caro and the Inuka Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: James' Group

texts.en:
Namatunzo is a group of four farmers in the Matete district with James selected as the Kiva representative. James has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right in the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 44 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant a quarter-acre of maize and a quarter-acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 KES.							

James joined One Acre Fund in 2009, and he is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  James joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices and get fertilizers and hybrid seeds.  Because he is an active community member, James has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved James's life because he has more profits from his harvest.  In the future, James hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school and save for the future. 						

James and the Namatunzo Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizers through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizers when prices are low and passes on the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seeds and fertilizers for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina, age 39, is a married woman and the mother of five children. She has been involved in a business of sewing gloves for a period of about five years. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently, she applied for a loan of Rs. 15,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads and wool along with packs of needles. This will help her to inflate her sales. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads and wool along with packs of needles.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees, age 41, is a married woman and the mother of six children. She has been involved in a business sewing gloves for about three years. She has a good client list and makes enough money to contribute to the family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, Balqees has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 with the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread and wool along with packs of needles. This will help her to increase her sales. Balqees is in her sixth loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread and wool along with packs of needles.

loans.name: Gloris Grisela

texts.es:
La señora Gloris  de 34  años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene 02 hijos que dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 10 años  a la venta de abarrotería como ser café, huevos, granos básicos, carnes y más.
 Doña Gloris es una mujer bien trabajadora es un ejemplo en la comunidad de trabajo y dedicación, con los préstamo ha mejorado su casa y también su condición económica, ahora tiene carro y bacas.
Doña Gloris está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de más productos como huevos, azúcar, pan, café. Arroz, frijoles, carnes, etc. para su negocio ya que desea surtirlo porque la demanda es bastante fuerte para esta época de navidad.  Con el apoyo del préstamo mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.
Doña Gloris su sueño es comprar  bacas lecheras para a si vender más cuajada y más leche logrando tener mejores ingresos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Gloris is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children who depend on her.  They live in the San Lorenzo community in the southern valley of Honduras.  She owns her own home, and for the past 10 years she has dedicated herself to selling groceries such as: coffee, eggs, basic grains, meats and other foods.  Gloris is a hardworking woman who is an example of dedication in the work community.

With the loans she has been able to improve her home and financial situation; she now has a car and cows.  Gloris is seeking a loan to purchase more products such as: eggs, sugar, bread, coffee, rice, beans, meat, etc. for her business as she hopes to stock the store since her demand is very high during the Christmas season.  With the help of this loan, she will improve her business and through that, her quality of life.  Gloris's dream is to purchase dairy cows in order to sell more curd and milk so she can increase her earnings.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - December, 2013.

loans.use: purchase eggs, sugar, bread, coffee, rice, beans, meat, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina, aged 60, is married to a company laborer and is blessed with seven children. She has been selling fish in their village for almost five years and earns a net income of PHP 300 per day. Her profits are usually spent on their food allowances. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 to purchase fish to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she can improve her business and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 31 years old and unmarried.  He has operated a farming business in Ndunyu Njeru for two years.  He is applying for a first loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizer and seeds. 

With anticipated profit, he plans to repay the loan and expand his farming business.

In the near future, he hopes to apply for bigger loans from Vision Fund Kenya to increase his farming business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 32-year-old man from Nakuru.  He is married to Esther and they are blessed with four children who are 13, 9, 2 and 1 years old.

He operates a business as a charcoal vendor and dealer.  He has been in the business for three years.  He earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES.  He has applied for his third loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya.  He plans to use the loan to buy more farm supplies.

He anticipates using his profits to repay this loan and educate his children.  In the future, he hopes to buy a plot of land and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 34 years old and comes from Nakuru, She is married and they are blessed with  three children aged 10, eight and five years old.

Catherine owns and operates a business as a caterer. She has been in the business for three years and earns a monthly income of KES.15,000. She has applied for her first loan of KES. 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the loan to boost and expand her catering business.

She plans  to use her anticipated profits to repay her loan, educate her children, and also expand her business. In future she hopes to have a restaurant in order to maximize her catering skills and increase her income as well as having a better living standard.

loans.use: To boost her catering business by increasing her stock of ingredients like eggs and flour.

loans.name: Ma. Belena

texts.en:
Ma. Belena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Belena requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 25 years now.

Ma. Belena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 46 years old and is from Nakuru, Kenya. She is married and is blessed with five children, ages 28, 26, 22, 19 and 12.

She owns a green grocery where she buys and sells fruits and vegetables. She has had this business for four years, and earns a monthly income of KES. 5,000. She has applied for her second loan of KES. 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the loan to increase her stock of fruits and vegetables to boost her business.

Salome anticipates using the profits from her business to pay her loan, educate her children, and boost her business. In the future, she hopes to buy a plot of land and build houses for rent to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Duaa

texts.en:
Because Duaa is a conservative woman, she asked her mother to take her place in the picture. Duaa is an 18-year-old woman who lives in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa, with her parents and four sisters and brothers. She is currently studying in her last year of high school. 

Duaa is planning to pass high school and to start studying in the university. But, her family is currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them in paying her upcoming semester tuition. For this reason, Duaa has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Eslam

texts.en:
Because Eslam is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Eslam was born in 1986. She is married and lives with her husband and 3 children in a sector in Jordan called Madaba. 

She has been running her mini market for 3 years. She started her business with a small amount of food products, in order to support her husband financially, and he is helping her with it. Then she started to expand it over time. 

Now she is planning to merchandise her mini market with a larger quantity of food products, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To merchandise her mini market with new products.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad was born in 1992. He is single and lives with his parents at a sector in Jordan called Salt. He is a student at the university and has worked as a photographer for 5 years. He opened his own studio. He began his business with 2 cameras. Mohammad would like to repair and redecorate his studio  to attract customers and to increase his profit.  He needs money to do this. For this reason, he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to repair his photography studio.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia was born in 1959. She is married and has 5 children, living in a sector in Jordan called Salt. One of her daughters is a student at the university majoring in Space Engineering. She is planning to work in her study field after graduation before starting her work life. However, because of the financial crisis Alia and her husband are facing, they could not pay for their daughter's upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Alia has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Moslah

texts.en:
Moslah is a 39-year-old man living in Sana'a. He is characterized as being very hardworking and he always wants to offer his family a good quality of life. He has been a barber for a long period in order to feed his family. 

With the intention of satisfying all of his customers, Moslah is looking for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to purchase more barber equipment to meet all of the demands for his business. He hopes to expand his business and attract new clients. He thanks Kiva lenders for financing his previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase more barber equipment to meet all of the demands for his business.

loans.name: Anderson Alexis

texts.es:
Anderson  estudia mecánica  automotriz, al principio no sabía que estudiar , estuvo averiguando cursos y no se decidía, hasta que un curso le llamo la atención en campo alto de reparar vehículos, hasta el momento se siente bien estudiando esta carrera ya que quería saber cómo era el mundo de los carros, como funcionan, que misterios tenían y por sobre todo como manejar. 
Anderson tiene una vida más o menos organizada, entrar a trabajar a una pequeña miscelánea a las 6:00 de la mañana para sostener económicamente sus estudios, tiene un horario de 6 horas de trabajo, después concluye su día asistiendo a clases de mecánica automotriz.
Anderson a parte de trabajar para poder pagar su carrera, la mama y el papa lo ayudan y apoyan en la formación dándole un 35%  de lo que pagan mensualmente ya que el trabajo en la miscelánea no es una fuente grande de ingresos, por este motivo el señor Anderson le llamo la atención una llamada que recibió de un subsidio que kiva le podía dar para financiar lo queda de su carrera, lo beneficia porque al señor Anderson le queda más cómodo  económicamente pagar menos de lo que está pagando actualmente y pues a su culminar sus estudios satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Anderson studies automotive mechanics.  At the beginning, he did not know what to study, he researched courses but could not decide, until an auto repair course called his attention.  So far, he is happy studying for this career because he wants to know about the automobile world, how they work, their secrets and how to drive them.  Anderson leads a fairly organized life.  He goes to work in a small general store at 6 in the morning in order to pay for his studies.  He works for 6 hours, and then finishes his day by going to his automotive mechanics classes. 

In addition to working to pay for his education, his mother and father help and support him but giving him 35% of the monthly fees as his work in the store does not provide him with enough income.  For this reason, a call from a Kiva partner caught his attention as they offered him a way to finance the remainder of his education.  This is beneficial for Anderson has it is better for him financially to pay less than what he is currently paying, allowing him to finish his education successfully.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 27-year-old young man, who works in business by profession and is single.  He owns a retail shop which is about 7km away from his home.  Isaac leaves home as early as 5am in order to manage the morning traffic jams so that he can open his shop early enough for his customers.  Due to the nature of his business, he is not able to use a charcoal stove to prepare breakfast or lunch while at work.  He says that electricity is very expensive to use so he instead resorts to eating in the nearby restaurant.

Isaac realizes that he spends a lot of money on eating in the restaurant.  With this package, he says that he will save both on food and cooking energy so that he can commence planning on building a house for himself and thereafter marrying.

Isaac is very grateful for the size of the stove and gas energy - it is very handy as he can use it at home as well as at work.  He acknowledges that had it not been for this KIVA loan, he wouldn’t have been able to access the cooking gas package.  Although he was aware of its clean advantages and efficiency, the initial costs were very high for him.

loans.use: to pay for a package of clean energy so that he can eat healthy

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is a diligent mother of seven children. Her husband drives a rickshaw. He works day and night so that he can earn enough to meet the needs of his family. He wants to provide a quality education and a bright future for his children. 

The rickshaw engine has stopped working and it needs to be repaired in order for him to continue working. The inability to work creates many financial issues and he is unable to pay monthly bills, school fees, and meet the daily basic needs of his family.

Naheed wants to help her husband.  She requests a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help her husband to continue earning an income. 

She is thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover repair costs for a rickshaw.

loans.name: Abdirahman Bashe

texts.en: Abdirahman Bashe is 23 years old. He studies at Gollis University, in the faculty of Information Technology. His main challenge is the lack of a laptop to use for his university lessons and assignments. He applied for a Kaaba laptop loan and is now waiting for the laptop. Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan, and Abdirahman Bashe will make monthly repayments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Abdiqadir Arab

texts.en: Abdiqadir Arab is a 27-year-old single man. He studies at the University of Hargeisa in the department of economics. He is a senior student. He needs a laptop to prepare his assignments, read his lessons when given as a soft copy, and download extra lessons. He requested a laptop from Kaaba and now he is on the wait list. Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan, and Abdiqadir will then make monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 52-year-old married mother of four children who has been running her convenience store for 13 years. A hard worker, she also helps out with her family's agricultural business, selling the dairy products they produce.

Zeinab is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy special requested items and offer products that will increase her income and meet her customers' needs. 

Zeinab hopes that one day she'll be capable of starting wholesale trade which will improve her family's socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: To buy special requested items and offer products that will increase her income and meet her customers' needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palms to build a selling space outside her shop.

loans.name: Elvis Gonzalo

texts.es: Elvis Gonzalo, soltero originario del municipio de chinandega, zona ubicada en el occidente del país, donde predomina el comercio, el turismo, es propietario de una pulperia ubicado en su casa de habitación donde ofrece productos de consumo del hogar como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles aceite, fósforos, papel higiénicos, productos congelados, golosinas, sopas maggi, galletas, entre otros, el realiza sus compras en distribuidoras y mercados de este municipio los cuales son al contado al igual que sus ventas, Elvis inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano para así brindarle un buen servicio a sus clientes, uno de sus sueños es lograr crecer mas en su negocio, y en un futuro no muy lejano terminar de construir su casa. el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de consumo que se le están agotando en existencia y de esta manera lograr aprovechar las fiestas navideña que es cuando mas demanda tiene de sus clientes. Elvis agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Elvis Gonzalo, single and from the Chinandega municipality in the west of  the country, an area high in trade, is a the owner of a grocery store which he runs out of his house.  He sells consumable goods such as rice, sugar, beans, oils, matches, toilet paper, frozen products, sweets, Maggi soups, biscuits and more. Elvis buys his products from local wholesalers and markets.  He buys in cash, and sells the same way.  Elvis starts his day very early in order to offer his customers good service.  One of Elvis's dreams is to expand his business further and, in the not-too-distant future, to finish building his house.  Elvis will use this loan to buy consumable goods that he is running out of.  He wants to take advantage of the Christmas season, when customer demand is at its highest.  Elvis is very grateful for the support that Kiva investors are offering people who have little money.

loans.use: to buy working capital, in the form of consumable household goods, and so further stock up his grocery store.

loans.name: Myrnalie

texts.en:
Myrnalie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell soft-drink and beer business in the Philippines. Myrnalie requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional cases of soft-drinks and beer to sell. 

Myrnalie has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, Myrnalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cases of soft-drinks and beer to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has five children who are still in school. She has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 9 years. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Mamerta is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mamerta is 46 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Mamerta has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines. Mamerta requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Mamerta has been in this business for four years. In the future, Mamerta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Jose Ovidio

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito debido a los buenos resultados que tuvo de la inversión anterior ya que le facilito la compra de insumos necesarios para tener una buena cosecha y tener mejores ganancias con las que ha mejorado sus condiciones familiares y ha cancelado sus deudas.
En está ocasión necesita capital para la compra de 4 cerdos, alimento (para cerdos y ganado), abono, fertilizantes y plaguicidas para las hortalizas, de esta manera continuara fortaleciendo y sacando el mejor provecho de su negocio.
texts.en:
José has decided to seek a new loan because of the good results he had from his previous investment which allowed him to purchase the necessary materials to have a good harvest and increase his earnings.  This has allowed him to improve his family's condition and pay off his debts.  

He is in need of capital to purchase four pigs, feed (for pigs and cattle), compost, fertilizers and pesticides for his vegetables.  This will allow him to continue to grow and make the most of his business.

loans.use: purchase 4 pigs, feed (for pigs and cattle), compost, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea, a sus 22 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos de 6 y 3 años y vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental. Trabajó durante 3 años en diferentes restaurantes, encargada de la preparación de algunos alimentos, pero con el fin de independizarse y poder estar más pendiente de sus hijos, desde hace 2 años decidió montar su propio negocio de venta de alimentos fritos, ubicado en la parte externa de su vivienda, allí trabaja de 2:00 a 8:00 pm durante toda la semana, su labor es realizada de manera muy artesanal, pues utiliza un fogón de leña para freír los alimentos que ofrece como empanadas, arepas de huevo, tortas de jamón, pasteles de pollo, entre otros y, de esta manera ha generado el sustento diario para su familia. Solicita el préstamo con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de una vitrina calentadora, una fogón a gas e insumos al por mayor (verduras, carne, aceite, salsas, gaseosas, entre otros), así podrá mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y disminuirá el riesgo que implica tener el fogón en leña, además optimizará el tiempo y podrá vender más productos, generando así un nivel de ingresos más alto. Andrea, con su espíritu emprendedor, perseverancia y motivada por el amor a su familia, dice que su principal meta es hacer que su negocio crezca para que le permita tener una estabilidad económica con la que pueda garantizar que sus hijos tengas una excelente educación y un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Andrea is 22 year old, and the mother of two children, ages six and three.  She is in a common law marriage and has been working in different restaurants over the past three years, cooking different foods, but decided to work on her own so she could better care for her children.  She started her own business two years ago, selling fried foods outside her home, where she works from 2:00 am to 8:00 pm all week.  She does this in a very artesian way, using a wood-burning stove to fry her foods, such as empanadas, corn cakes with egg, ham sandwiches, and other things, and manages to earn enough to support her family.  She is asking for a loan to buy a heated display case, a gas stove, and supplies in quantity (vegetates, meat, cooking oil, sauces, soft drinks, and other things) so she can improve her working conditions and reduce the risk of working with firewood.  She will also make better use of the time and be able to sell more and increase her income.  Andrea, with her entrepreneurial spirit, perseverance, and motivation through love for her family says that her main goal is to grow her business so that she will have financial stability so she can guarantee that her children will have a good education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 56 years old and has a retail shop which she has been running for 15 years now. She is married and together with her spouse they have six children who are all above 18 years. 

She plans to use this loan to pay for the installation of electrical power in her house. She will use the generated profits from her business to repay the loan. 

This is her third loan; she paid all her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To install electrical power in her house.

loans.name: Fanuel's Group

texts.en:
Fanuel is a member of Imani Group in Busia District.  He is pictured here in a group of six One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 85 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Fanuel has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 KES for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.
		
The 2013 Long Rains season will be Fanuel’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He joined this year in order to earn enough to feed family. As an active member in his community, Fanuel also volunteered his time to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he was proposed by other members in his group. Fanuel plans on using his future profits from his harvest to send his children to school. He believes that his life will improve by working with One Acre Fund because he will be able to feed his family.			
	
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Fanuel and the Imani Group will use the Kiva loan to cover the initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues to provide training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Pius' Group

texts.en:
Pius is a member of Arise & Shine Group in Chwele District.  He is pictured here in a group of five One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 69 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Pius has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving inputs for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Pius is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with eight children.  Pius is 36 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 10 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Pius is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group.  He described his harvest last year as good.  He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and enjoy the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.
							
Pius first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Pius joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to help more farmers.  Pius plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Pius’s own life has improved because he has more farm training. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Pius and the Arise & Shine Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Vitalis' Group

texts.en:
Vitalis is a member of Imara Group in Busia District.  He is pictured here in a group of 7 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 80 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Vitalis has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving 1/2 acre of maize and 1/2 acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
The 2013 Long Rains season will be Vitalis’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He joined this year in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, get  fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school.  As an active member in his community, Vitalis also volunteered his time to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader. He wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Vitalis plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business.  He believes that his life will improve by working with One Acre Fund because he has more farm training and has more farm group support.
													
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Vitalis and the Imara Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will continue providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Mayra Lorena

texts.es:
Mayra, es una madre soltera que disfruta la dicha de ver crecer a su pequeña hija, ella vive en casa alquilada junto a su hija y una tía, debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para cubrir sus gastos y los de su hija, a lado de su tía  aprendió vender ropa de forma ambulante, también tiene una venta de tortillas, no tiene un horario establecido y ha adquirido mucha experiencia en dicha actividad.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de blusas, camisas, faldas y pantalones, para surtir el inventario y de esa forma estar preparada para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, espera aumentar sus ventas, tener mayores ingresos y mejorar su economía.
Anhela tener los ingresos necesarios para tener un local propio donde atenderá mejor a sus clientes, tendrá un negocio más rentable y le dará mejores condiciones de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Mayra is a single mother and is enjoying watching her little girl grow.  Mayra lives with her daughter and an aunt in a rented house.  Given her need to earn an income to cover her daughter's and her own costs, Mayra learned from her aunt to sell clothes as a street vendor.  Mayra also sells tortillas.  She has no fixed working hours and has a lot of experience in her work.

Mayra will invest this loan in buying blouses, shirts, skirts, and trousers to stock up her business and thus be prepared to handle her customers' needs.  Mayra hope to increase her sales, have a higher income, and improve her financial situation.

Mayra longs to have the necessary income to have her own premises where she can better serve her customers.  Her business would be more profitable and Mayra could offer her daughter better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy blouses shirts, skirts, and trousers.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre agricultor de 33 años de edad, el está en unión simple junto a su esposa y vive en Sololá. El tiene tres hijos de ellos uno es varón y dos mujeres. Ellos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad y lo apoyan en el campo en tiempos libres. 
El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando cebolla, papa y repollo en parcelas que tiene a pocos metros de su vivienda, esto lo aprendió de su padre desde niño cuando el estudiaba en la escuela primaria y ayudaba en el campo de la agricultura y eso fue su primer trabajo. El ahora cuenta con seis años de realizar su propio cultivo viendo que obtiene ganancias buenas cultivando estas verduras.
De este modo el solicita un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 para comprar semillas de papa, plantillas de repollo y su fertilizante para cultivar y cosecharlo mejorando sus ingresos junto a su familia. El sueña con expandir su cultivo mejorando sus ganancias y terminar de construir una vivienda que tiene para su familia y darles mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 33-year-old famer. He is in a simple union with his wife and he lives in Sololá. He has three children, one boy and two girls. They study in a community school and support him in the fields in their spare time.

He makes a living in agriculture growing onions, potatoes, and cabbage in plots that he has a few meters from his home. He learned this from his father when he was a child, when he studied in primary school and helped in the fields, which was his first work. He now has worked his own crops for six years, and has seen that he obtains good profits from cultivating these vegetables.

Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 8,000.00 quetzals to purchase potato seeds, cabbage plantlings, and fertilizer to cultivate and harvest them, improving his income along with his family. He dreams of expanding his profits and finishing construction on a home that he has for his family to give them better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds, cabbage plantlings, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia, age 35, is a married woman with four children. She is involved in a business sewing gloves to contribute in her family income. Nazia works hard to fulfill her family’s needs including food, health and education. She has a good client list but, due to the lack of availability of funds, is unable to meet her increasing customer demand.

Nazia is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy more spools of thread and wool in different colors along with packs of needles. She hopes her loan will create a means of increasing her revenue so she can generate a healthier income. Nazia hopes to have a good experience with her new loan.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread and wool in different colors along with packs of needles

loans.name: Parven

texts.en:
Parven, age 28, is a married woman and the mother of two children. She has been successfully running a small general store for the past six months with her husband at the corner of her house. Parven’s husband is a security guard in a factory with low salary, so she is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. 

Parven is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet her increasing customer demand and grow her business. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is 24-year-old married lady and enjoys doing the work of hand embroidery. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory and she earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family. She is the mother of three children and is motivated to provide them with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. 

In order to meet the growing demand for her embroidery she needs to buy more frames, needles and threads in different colors. For this reason she requested a loan of 35,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) from  Kashf Foundation. She is on her second loan with a good credit history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and threads in different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen, age 45, is a widow woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has eight years of experience in this field. One of her sons assists her by purchasing a stock of goods from the market. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy oil, beverages and packs of salt to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy oil, beverages and packs of salt.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 45-year-old widow and the mother of three children. For about 10 years she is been working in the business of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested Kashf Foundation for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.  It will help her in meeting the orders of her customers on time. Razia dreams of her children's bright future and well being.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela, age 27, is a married woman and the mother of three children.  She does stitching work in her house to support her family and for a better future. She stitches clothes for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family, as her husband is working in a factory with a low salary income. 

To cope with the increasing demands of her customers, Shakeela requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en:
Hameedan is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She works on a winding machine to wrap threads and wool onto spools and reels. She has been doing it for about three years with the support of her husband. She works hard on her machine every day, so she may earn a living for her family and provide food, health, and education. 

Hameedan requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation which she will use to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors, as well as some tools used in the machinery. In this way, she would be able to inflate her sales which will ultimately help in generating more cash. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors, as well as some tools used in the machinery.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en: Safaa is a married woman who was born in 1985. She lives with her two daughters in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. Her husband is in the military. She decided to help her husband financially by selling blankets one year ago. Then she started selling a very small quantity of detergent and found it profitable. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of detergent in order to raise her sales to help her husband in covering their children's needs, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more detergent for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package in order to save on cooking energy needs

loans.name: Heba

texts.en: Hiba is a 19-year-old lady who lives in a rented house with her parents and 2 brothers in a sector in Jordan called Irbid. She is currently studying for a diploma, majoring in Health Services Management. She is in her 1st year. She is planning to find a job in her study field after graduation so as to start supporting her family financially. They are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay her upcoming semester tuition. For this reason, Hiba has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Abdirahman Omer

texts.en:
Abdirahman Omer is a 26-year-old single man. He finished at Admas University College in 2012, faculty of Business Administration. He is the owner of Ahlan private school and he needs a projector to use in his teaching. 

He requested the projector from Kaaba, and now he is waiting for the projector. Kaaba will provide the projector as a loan, and Abdirahman will make monthly payments. When he gets the projector he will more easily teach the students.

loans.use: To buy a projector for educational purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package as he wishes to prevent dirt fumes from paraffin

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 45-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her family. Her son has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. He also assists his younger brother by purchasing a stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Allah Rakhi is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and clothing and also cover health expenses. She wants to grow her son's business, so she requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. 

She is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan, and she is in her fifth loan cycle with good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in the store's earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Awil Nour

texts.en: Awil Nour is 20 years old. He is a secondary school student. He wants to start at the university, as he is finishing secondary school this year. He needs a laptop and requested that Kaaba give him a laptop as a loan; then he will pay back in installments. Now he is waiting for the laptop. Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan, and Awil will make monthly repayments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nelia works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store. Nelia is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional inventory of ready-to-wear clothing to sell at her business.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Jean D`amour

texts.en:
Jean D'Amour is 38 years old. He is married with two children and they both go to school. He would like to use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production

loans.name: Vilma Gloribel

texts.es:
Vilma, es casada tiene un hijo, vive junto a su familia, debido a la necesidad de apoyar con los gastos de su casa se preparó tomando clases de cosmetología, hoy en día cuenta con su sala de belleza, la cual atiende de 8:30 a.m. a 8:00 p.m., ya tiene cuatro años de experiencia en el negocio, hasta el momento no ha tenido ningún problema en realizar esta actividad.
Comprará tintes, esmaltes, cremas, labiales, etc., con lo que tendrá todo lo necesario para atender mejor a su clientela, espera fortalecer el inventario de su negocio, tener más clientes, dar un buen servicio, aumentar sus ingresos para cancelar sus cuotas y seguir aportando en los gastos de su hogar.
Vilma persigue el sueño de apoyar a su hijo en sus estudios universitarios y en un futuro no muy lejano comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Vilma is married and has one son. She lives with her family owing to the necessity of supporting them with the home expenses. He prepared herself by taking cosmetology classes. She now has her own beauty parlor, which she attends from 8:30 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. Since she has four years of experience in the business, until now she has not had any problems carrying out this activity.

She will purchase dyes, nail polish, creams, lipstick, etc., with which she will have everything necessary to attend to her clientele. She hopes to strengthen her business’s inventory, have more customers, provide good service, and increase her income to pay off her debts and continue contributing to paying home expenses.

Vilma is chasing her dream of supporting her son in his university studies, and in the not very far future purchasing her own home.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, nail polish, creams, lipstick, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more goats for her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 53 years old and married to Isabella. Together, they are blessed with three children between 7 and twelve years old. For the past 20 years, John has been running a tailoring business in Kapsabet. He generates an average monthly income of 50,000 KES.

John is requesting a 70,000 KES loan to purchase bags of sewing materials and shoes to resell. He plans to use the anticipated profit from his loan to expand his business and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of sewing materials and shoes to resell

loans.name: Stanslous

texts.en:
Stanslous has a motorcycle transport business in Kangundo town and has been in this business for five years. He is 35 years old, married, and he and his spouse have been blessed with two children.

He plans to use this loan to buy motorcycle spare parts and service his motorcycle so that it will be in good condition. He also plans to buy a cooker for his wife to start a french fries (chips) business. He will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of his family. 

This is his first loan term, and his future hopes are to own more motorcycles for the transport business, educate his children, and give them a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 30 years old. He would like to use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With the profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic cups, plates, and food containers

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah is 22 years old. He recently got married and is living in Mafraq, Jordan with his wife. He works in a clothing shop and is also studying for his Bachelor's degree in English Language. He is in his fourth year and is one step closer to graduation. Abdullah is planning to find a job in his field after graduation in order to start supporting his wife financially, as they are facing financial crisis. Because he doesn't have enough money to pay for his next semester fees, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Macraline's Group

texts.en:
Macraline is a member of Amuka Group in Matete District.  She is pictured here in a group of four with One Acre Fund group leader.  The group  represent a total of 42 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Macraline has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving inputs for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.
							
Macraline is married and has eight children.  She is 50 years old and is known as friendly and hardworking.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and prayer group.  Macraline has been a farmer for 30 years.  She described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Macraline is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Macraline joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods and earn enough to feed her family.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member and wants to help more farmers.  Macraline plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and buy a cow.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Macraline’s own life was improved because she has more profits from her harvest and was able to feed the family.  							

Macraline and the Amuka Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a 19-year-old lady who lives with her parents and 3 sisters and brothers in a sector of Jordan called Mafraq. She is currently studying for a Bachelor's degree, majoring in Law Accounting Management. She is in her 1st year. She is planning to find a job in her study field after graduation to start supporting her family financially, as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay her upcoming semester tuition. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Amin Mohamed

texts.en: Amin Mohamed is 19 years old.  He studies at Abarso Tech University, in the faculty of software engineering. He needs a laptop to prepare his assignments and his lessons. He requested a laptop from Kaaba and now he is waiting for the laptop. Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan, and Mohamed will make monthly repayments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: Saniye

texts.en:
Saniye is a single mother who has devoted her life to her family and lives with her sisters.  When she first started out, she sold children’s clothing around her neighborhood.  Eventually, going where her friends invited her she earned a better income.  Later she went to sell at markets and borrowed money to buy a car with her uncle’s support.  With the car she was able to go to the city market all year round.  For 10 years, she sold her products both in her neighborhood and at the city market to improve her economic situations.  With the money she earned, she paid off the car loan.  She sold the car and bought a bigger one with the money and some of her earnings from the market.  She increased the variety of her products.  She continued like this for 10 years.

After 10 years Saniye decide to open a store.  Through the force of her determination, the support of her friends and family, and her economic position, she opened a children’s clothing and novelty shop.  For four months she kept going to sell at city markets.  She is requesting a loan from Maya, which she will use to buy more types of children’s clothing for her shop, increase the customer capacity of the store, and make it more visually appealing.  Her goal is to buy more products, expand her business, and open a wholesale store in the future.  Eventually she wants to open a children’s clothing factory and start mass production.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 36-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children and equally responsible for all the family. 

She belongs to an ultra poor family, and that is why she cannot afford the educational expenses of both her children. One of her sons goes with his father to help him in his activities. Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he manufactures iron objects such as doors, windows, tables, etc. He also provides door to door service to his customers. Due to the increase in iron prices he is unable to buy sufficient welding materials such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc. to carry on his business.

To meet the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise efficiently, he needs some capital to buy welding material. Sofia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he would be able to buy iron rods to carry on his business. 

Sofia is very glad and thankful to the Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy iron rods for manufacturing doors, windows, tables, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is 19 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in Wihdat, Jordan. Her husband works as a driver and also sells different kinds of meat at his own store, which he has been doing for one year to earn a better income and to cover his family needs. 

Alaa is requesting a youth loan as her husband is planning to expand this project by buying new types of meat to sell. He does not have enough money to make the purchases. Her husband is in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase new types of meat for her husband's business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the cooking gas appliances so that she can free up some time to get into paid employment

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is a 32-year-old married man who raises cattle. He uses his income to support the survival of his family. He chose this kind of business because he could get milk and also sell the cows when he needs money. He usually buys young cows that he feeds well,  and later sells them when they have fattened. He will us the money to buy more cows. He is a hard working man.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing supplies such as sewing machine needles, threads, material, elastic, buttons and more.

loans.name: Muthama

texts.en:
Muthama is 47 years old and runs a butcher shop in Kangundo town. He is married and together with his spouse he has been blessed with three children. He has been in this business for eight years and it has been profitable.

He plans to use this loan to buy more meat for resale to his customers. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and also improve the living standard of his family. 

This is his third loan and he repaid the previous loans successfully. In future he hopes to grow his business and be prosperous.

loans.use: To buy more meat for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 4 heifers.

loans.name: Issac

texts.en:
Isaac is 26 years old. He is married with one child. He would like to use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is 42 years old and married. Together with her spouse, they have been blessed with two children. She has a butcher shop and has been in the business for five years now. She will use this loan to add more stock of meat to sell. This will enable her to make more income which she will use to educate her children. This is her first loan term and in future she hopes to grow her business by selling more meat and to be successful.

loans.use: To add stock of meat to resell.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Amani is a group of 6 farmers in Matete District with Grace selected as the Kiva representative.  Grace has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 61 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Grace is 55 years old and has been a farmer for 15 years.  Grace works as a farmer to provide for her 6 children.  The community and other farmers know Grace as friendly, hardworking and trustworthy.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community such as the women's group and prayer group.  Grace described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.							

Grace is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Grace joined One Acre Fund in order to get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed her family.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member and wants to help more farmers.  Grace plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school and invest in a business.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Grace’s own life was improved because she has more farm training and was able to feed the family.

Grace and the Amani Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is a member of Furaha Group in Chwele District.  She is pictured here in a group of five One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 58 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Rose has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Rose is 46 years old and has been a farmer for 43 years.  Rose works as a farmer to provide for her 5 children.  The community and other farmers know Rose as friendly, hardworking and trustworthy.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community activities such as the women's group and prayer group.  Rose described her harvest last year as excellent, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.							

Rose joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Rose joined One Acre Fund so that she could get new farming methods, earn enough to feed family and send children to school.
