Because she likes being a leader and is an active community member, she wants to help more farmers in her community. Rose has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Rose's life because she has more profits from harvest, able to save money and feed the family.  In the future, Rose hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school and buy a cow. 
 							
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Rose and the Furaha Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continue providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Doña Amparo es una señora humilde, emprendedora, luchadora con una edad de 45 años, casada y madre de 7 hijos quienes le ayudan en las diferentes actividades del campo pero solo 3 dependen de ella y estudian en la escuela de la comunidad en diferentes grados de educación ya que los otros 4 viven en hogares aparte. Con un grado de estudio de primaria incompleta cursado hasta el 3 grado ella agradece el apoyo moral y financieros por parte de sus padres a pesar de las muchas dificultades en esa época pues los ingresos generados no eran los necesarios para cubrir con todos los gastos y decidieron enseñarle a ella y a sus hermanos a trabajar la tierra que por más de 20 años ha practicado. Otra forma de generar ingresos en su hogar es por medio de una pequeña pulperia que tiene en su casa de habitación. La tierra que trabaja es una herencia por parte de su padre y con ese pequeño pedazo empezaron a trabajar y a generar más ingresos para comprar más tierra y tener lo que hoy en día tienen aproximadamente 5 manzanas cultivadas de café y todas productoras las cuales están ubicadas a 2 kilómetros de su casa de habitación a la cual en familia se trasladan en vestía o caminando para dar asistencia y mantenimiento.
Sus metas poder terminar de apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios para que se conviertan en personas profesionales y de provecho, con mejores oportunidades en la vida que el trabajo de campo ya que es pesado y en ocasiones con los cambios climáticos y las plagas entre otras muchas veces se pierde el trabajo de meses y las ganancias son pocas.     
Ella ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes y foliares para asistir sus cultivos y poder sembrar una nueva plantilla para seguir ampliando su cafetal.
texts.en:
Amparo, 45, is a humble, enterprising, and hardworking woman. She is a married mother of seven children, who help her with her farm labor. Only three of her children are dependent. They are studying in the village school in different grades. The other four children live in separate houses. 

She did not complete primary school, studying only until the third grade. She is grateful for her parents' moral and financial support, despite the fact that during that time they had many difficulties and their income was not sufficient to send her to school. They decided instead to teach her and her siblings to work on the farm, which she has done for more than twenty years. She also has a small grocery store in her home to earn extra money. 

The land on which she works was inherited from her father. With this small plot, they started to work and earn money to buy more land. Now they have approximately five plots of productive coffee crops. The land is located two kilometers away from the family home. They travel on horseback or walk to the plot to maintain the crops.

Amparo's goals are to finish supporting her children with their studies so that they can become good professionals with better opportunities in life than working on the farm, as it is exhausting. Sometimes changes in climate or infestations, among other issues, can take away months of work and the earnings are low.

She is applying for this loan to buy fertilizer and plant spray to maintain her crops and to plant new crops to continue expanding her coffee plantation.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Fredrick's Group

texts.en:
Fredrick is a member of Ahsante Group in the Chwele District.  He is pictured here in a group of 5 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 58 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Fredrick has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.							

Fredrick is married and has 10 children.  He is 67 years old and is known as reliable.  He is active in his community in groups such as the burial committee.  Fredrick has been a farmer for 38 years.  Fredrick described his harvest last year as good, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with the One Acre Fund.  							

Fredrick joined the One Acre Fund in 2009 so that he could learn new farming methods. He is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader and has gotten more involved as a Kiva representative because he wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Working with the One Acre Fund has improved Fredrick's life because he has more farm training.  In the future, Fredrick hopes that his profits in 2014 can be used to send children to school. 

Fredrick and the Ahsante Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through the One Acre Fund.  The One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  The One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, the One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back. With support from the One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	
						

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Grethel Jahaira

texts.es: Grethel Jahaira, mayor de edad casada con un hijo menor de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega , zona donde predomina el comercio, ron, la caña y al azúcar al igual que uno de los ingenios mas grande del país, esta microempresaria se dedica a la compra y venta de variedades estilos de ropa nueva y prendas de acero como: cadenas, anillos, pulseras, aretes entre otros, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsables en sus pagos, humilde y con muchos deseos de superación personal. poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante e incrementando mas su negocio la mayor parte de su mercadería la mantiene e cuentas por cobrar por lo que ella entrega a clientes fijos y eventuales en sus negocios. el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en la compra de mercadería como: anillos, pulseras, cadenas, ropa entre otros, par así incrementar su inventario y aprovechas la temporada navideñas donde los clientes buscan ropa, accesorios de vestir entre otros, al incrementar su inventario sus clientes tienen más variedad de ropa para escoger, sus ventas aumentarían y por lo tanto sus ganancia también incrementa, uno de sus sueños es poder construir sui propia casa y establecer una tienda en ella. Grethel agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: Grethel Jahaira is a married adult from one of the towns of Chinandega. In this area trade, rum, sugar cane and sugar dominate, as well as one of the greatest geniuses in the country. This micro-businesswoman buys and sells different styles of new clothing and steel jewelry such as chains, bracelets, earrings and more. She is characterized as being a hardworking woman who is responsible with her payments, humble, and very eager to get ahead personally. Little by little, she has been able to get ahead and increase her business. Most of the merchandise is sold on credit and she delivers to regular and new customers. The purpose of the loan is to invest in buying merchandise such as rings, bracelets, chains, clothing and more. This way, she can increase her inventory and her customers will have more variety of clothing to choose from. Her sales will increase and her earnings as well. One of her dreams is to build her own home and set up a store in it. Grethel is very grateful for the support that the Kiva investors offer to people of low income.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as different styles of clothes, steel jewelry, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cookies, candy, chocolates and chewing gum.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora María Yolanda de 43 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus cinco hijos en su casa de habitación ubicada en San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras,  se dedica desde hace ya varios años al negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas.
Doña María Yolanda su venta es en la portuaria y sus clientes son   personas que llegan a su casa a comprar las tortillas y los restaurantes de la zona para vender para el almuerzo y cena, es una mujer trabajadora que desea mejorar su casa. 
Doña María Yolanda solicita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal que son la materia prima que necesita para elaborar las tortillas, también necesita para comprar tres quintos de pintura para mejora de vivienda. Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y comprar lo que necesita para seguir trabajando.
Doña María Yolanda su sueño  es mejorar su casa ya que tiene un sueño para este nuevo año que es cambiarle el techo a la casa donde ella vive.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2013.
texts.en:
María Yolanda is 43 years old and lives with her husband and five children in her home in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.  María has a had a business making and selling tortillas for a number of years.

María's business in near the port. Her customers are private individuals and restaurant from the local area who buy her products to sell for lunch and dinner. María is a hard-working woman who wants to make improvements to her house.

María is applying for a loan in order to buy corn, firewood and lime, the main supplies that she needs to make tortillas.  She also needs this loan to buy paint to improve her home.  With the support of this loan, María intends to improve her income and buy the things she needs to continue working.

María's dream in to improve her home.  Her big dream for this new year is to replace the roof on her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras. December 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime for her business.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 26 years old and married. He and his spouse they have been blessed with one child. He sells phone accessories and also runs a mobile money transfer business. He has been in this business for one year and makes a monthly income of 7,500 KES.

He will use this loan to buy more phone accessories such as batteries, phone chargers, covers and earphones to resell. He will also use part of the loan to add money float to his mobile money transfer business. 

He will use the generated profits to improve his business. This is his first loan term and his future hopes are to provide the basic needs for his family and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories to resell.

loans.name: Nuevo Renacimiento Group

texts.es:
Nuevo Renacimiento es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 8 mujeres que se dedican al comercio, este grupo se encuentra ubicado en el Municipio de Tierra Blanca donde las principales actividades económicas son el comercio y la ganadería, este lugar es conocido por su clima caluroso y de ahí que algunas personas lo conocen como "La novia del sol". 
Lidia es uno de los integrantes de este grupo ella platica que tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su hogar desde hace 4 años, ella inicio con este negocio ya que quería trabajar para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de hogar, ella dice que tiene buena venta ya que es una de las únicas tiendas en su barrio, además ella siempre trata de tener variedad de productos y tratar amablemente a sus clientes para que vuelvan hacerle el gasto. Un crédito de VisionFund le ayudara a comprar detergentes, jabón de baño,pan, papel higénico,arroz, frijol, refrescos, productos enlatados, leche, aceite, dulces, jugos para resurtir su negocio. 
Ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio continúe progresando y pueda dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Este grupo agradece a VisionFund por el apoyo que les brindan a través de estos créditos para sus negocios.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son: 

Virginia venta de frutas y legumbres
Maritzabel venta de pan y gelatinas
Olga Lidia venta de frutas y legumbres
Santa venta de ropa interior
María Natividad venta de comida
Magdalena venta de  articulos para el hogar(topper)
Jaqueline venta de comida
texts.en:
New Rebirth is the name of a group composed of 8 women who work as merchants. This group is located in the municipality of Tierra Blanca where the primary economic activities are trade and raising livestock. This area is known for its hot climate, hence some people call it "the girlfriend of the sun."

Lidia is one of the members of this group. She told us that she has had a grocery store in her home for four years. She began this business because she wanted to work to help her husband with their household expenses. She says that her sales are going well and it is one of the only stores in her neighborhood. Moreover, she always tries to have a variety of products and to treat her customers in a friendly way so that they will return to complete their purchases. A loan from VisionFund will help her to purchase detergents, bath soap, toilet paper, rice, beans, drinks, canned goods, milk, oil, candies and juices to resupply her business. She hopes that with this investment her business will continue to grow and she will be able to give her family a better quality of life. 

This group is grateful for VisionFund because of the support that it is providing through these loans for their businesses. The other members of the group are:

Virginia who sells fruit and vegetables
Maritzabel who sells bread and jams
Olga Lidia who sells fruit and vegetables
Santa who sells undergarments 
María Natividad who sells food
Magdalena who sells tupperware
Jaqueline who sells food

loans.use: to purchase groceries (detergents, bath soap, bread, toilet paper, rice, beans, drinks, canned goods, milk, oil, candies and juices).

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a very hardworking lady from Nakuru. She is 37 years old, married to Nelson, and they are blessed with three children ages 13, 10, and 6 years old. She sells clothing in a business she has been running for the past five years. She would like to buy a motorcycle for her spouse, who is currently unemployed, to help increase her family's income. To enable her buy this motorcycle, she has applied for her third loan of 97,500 KES from KADET LTD.

Her monthly income right now is 16,000 KES, and her plan is to use profits realized from her expanded business to pay her loan back to KADET LTD, educate her children, and expand her clothing business. She hopes to be financially stable and have a happy family in the future.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her spouse to use for transportation of customers to help increase the family's income.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, solicita un crédito nuevo para comprar ladrillos, cemento, hierro, y arena, para hacerle algunas mejoras a su vivienda y darle un ambiente más seguro a su familia.
Con la inversión anterior ella fortaleció el negocio adquiriendo la materia prima para su venta de tortillas y venta de productos de belleza, para fortalecer su negocio con lo que sus clientes aumentaron, sus ventas son mayores y su economía mejorada le permite cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Catalina is asking for a loan to buy bricks, cement, iron and sand to do some home improvement and give her family a safer environment. 

With the previous loan, she fortified her business, acquiring more raw materials for selling tortillas and beauty products. Her customers increased, she had more sales and her finances improved, allowing her to cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, iron and sand.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is 25 years old. He is married with one child. He would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers for maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. He wishes to invest profits from his farming in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Orlando De Jesus

texts.es:
Orlando, tiene 26 años, tiene dos hijos de 6 y 9 años de edad, bajo sus hombros descansa la responsabilidad de llevar los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, se decida a la pesca de mariscos, el aprendió esta actividad por iniciativa propia y ya cuenta con 10 años de experiencia y a la fecha no ha tenido ningún problema en realizar esta actividad.
Comprará un trasmallo y redes, para realizar su pesca, con lo que espera tener mejores herramientas que le generen una buena pesca, para aumentar sus ventas, mejorar sus ingresos, y cancelar sus deudas.
Desea fortalecer su negocio, para tener ingresos con los que cubrirá los gastos familiares y les dará a sus hijos la oportunidad de superarse académicamente.
texts.en:
Orlando, 26, has two children, ages 6 and 9. He carries the responsibility of bringing home enough money to cover the household expenses. He works as a shellfish fisherman. He learned this activity on his own initiative and he has ten years of experience. He has not had any problems so far with this work.

He will use this loan to buy a trammel net and fishing nets for his fishing. He hopes that with this loan, he will have better tools to have a successful catch, to increase his sales, improve his income, and to pay off his debts.

He wishes to strengthen his business and to have earnings to cover the family expenses, giving his children the opportunity to succeed in school.

loans.use: to buy a trammel net and fishing nets.

loans.name: Yessenia Josefina

texts.es: Yessenia es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. De oficio comerciante se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa variada. Se siente agradecida con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que ha logrado ampliar el negocio y obtener mejores ganancias. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar ropa tales como: Trajes de niño, blusas, pantalones entre otros. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a expandir su negocio y tener mayor rentabilidad.
texts.en: Yessenia is originally from the city of Granada.  She is a businesswoman, running a business that sells clothes.  Yessenia is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito as she has been able to expand her business and earn higher profits.  She is applying for another loan in order to clothes, such as children's clothes, blouses, trousers and more.  Yessenia thinks that this loan will help her to expand her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy clothes, such as children's clothes, blouses, trousers and more.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. For the past two years, she has been selling poultry at the market to the general public. The main challenges for her business are unstable market prices and diseases affecting the poultry. 

Saumu requested a loan from Yehu for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase more poultry and vaccine. She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry and vaccine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases more clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 62 years old and divorced. She lives alone in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa. Jamila has been facing a financial crisis, which pushed her to start selling blankets five years ago. To earn additional income, she fills water gallons and sells them to stores. 

As it is the winter season, Jamila requested a loan, which she will use to buy a larger quantity of blankets to sell.

loans.use: to purchase blankets

loans.name: Sevgi

texts.en:
Sevgi, mother of one, used to make artificial flowers as a hobby when she was married. After she and her husband separated, she had to support herself and her son. With the help of her father, she opened a small artificial flower shop at a local mall. At first she sold bridal arrangements and flowers for the home at the shop. Then she slowly began to develop her business. She began to prepare traditional wedding candy, flowers and vow trays (trays that hold the rings and other small items at Turkish weddings). At first she sold retail at her shop. Then she opened a small workshop and began to design vow trays wholesale for the shopkeepers in the city. Now Sevgi has two retail stores and a workshop. With the loan from Maya, she wants to have flower products delivered to her workshop to sell at her shop. She aims to increase her customers and her profits this way. Her goals are to develop her workshop into a factory, do a lot of business and prepare a good future for her son.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

1 çocuk annesi olan sevgi daha önce evliyken de evde yapma çiçek hobi olarak yapıyordu.  Eşinden ayrıldıktan sonra oğlu ve kendisi yaşamaya başlamış.  Ailesi babasının desteği ile esnaf sarayında yapma çiçek üzerine küçük bir dükkan açmış.  Önce gelinlik ve ev çiçekleri satışı yapmış dükkanında.  Daha sonra işini yavaş yavaş geliştirmeye başlamış.  Nikah şekeri, çiçekler, söz tepsileri hazırlamaya başlamış.  Önce parekende olarak dükkanın da satmaya başladı.  Daha sonra küçük bir atölye açtı ve şehrinde bulunan esnaflara toptan söz tepsileri dizayn etmeye başladı.  Sevgi’nın şu an 2 adet satış mağazası ve 1 adet atölyesi var.  Maya’dan kullanacağı kredi ile atalyösine çiçek ürünleri temin edip bunları dükkanında satmak istiyor.  Böylece müşterisi arttığı gibi kazancını da yükseltmeyi hedefliyor.  Hedefleri atölyesini fabrika haline getirmek ve  çok sayıda iş sağlamak ve oğluna iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak.

loans.use: to buy artificial flower products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Alfred's Group

texts.en:
Alfred is a member of the Exodus Group in Chwele District. Alfred became a One Acre Fund group leader because he was elected by other members in his group. He is pictured here in a group of 9 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 87 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Alfred has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. Alfred is also involved in the community's Faulu Kenya.  							

He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.							

Alfred is 70 years old and has been a farmer for 40 years. Alfred works as a farmer to provide for his 22 children. The community and other farmers know Alfred  as reliable and trustworthy. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community's activities such as the prayer group. Alfred described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.

The 2014 Long Rains season won’t be Alfred ’s first season with One Acre Fund. He first joined One Acre Fund in 2012 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods and earn enough to feed his family. As an active member in his community, Alfred also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to help more farmers. Alfred plans on using future profits from the harvest to repair his home and buy a cow. His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he has more profits from the harvest and is able to feed his family.
							
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Alfred and the Exodus Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items including toothpaste, soap, drinks, and hair relaxer.

loans.name: Matias

texts.es: Don Matías,  tiene 61 años de edad,  es casado, tiene 4 hijos y  vive en una aldea del municipio de Gracias Lempira.  Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, produce, maíz, frijoles y café,  y en temporadas a la venta de animales como  vacas o cerdos. Actualmente el cultivo fuerte es el café, el cual lo vende en despulpado en grano. Esta solicitando el sexto ciclo de préstamo que es por 4,000 Lempiras para comprar bolsas de foliar(fertilizantes) para asistencia al cultivo de café y mejorar la producción y ganancias. Su plan es ampliar la producción sembrando mas plantas de café y poder mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Matías, 61, is married with four children. He lives in a village in the municipality of Gracias Lempira. He has worked in agriculture his entire life. He grows corn, beans, and coffee. In some seasons he sells animals such as cows or pigs. Coffee is currently his strongest crop, which he sells in ground form. 

He is applying for a sixth loan of 4,000 Honduran lempiras. He will use this loan to buy bags of plant fertilizer for his coffee crops so that he can improve his production and earnings. His plan is to expand his production by planting more coffee plants, thereby improving his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy plant fertilizer for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: La Señora Erika  tiene 20 años y es casada tiene una  Hija de 1 año y medio de edad, Erika se dedica a la Venta de Juguetes de segunda mano compra por fardo y lo vende por unidad, ella tiene su puesto de venta en la zona Villa La Merced pero también vende en distintas ferias, Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Erika  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería de temporada por las fiestas de fin de año Comprará 5 fardos de juguetes, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo ya que esta época tiene mucha venta y por esta razón quiere abastecerse de mercadería,  la señora Erika enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el tener que moverse de feria en feria, para vender sus productos, lo cual le genera inseguridad debido a que esto es un poco peligroso, y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mercadería,  la señora Erika es una persona joven con ganas de salir adelante de mejorar su negocio, se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Erika is 20 years old, married and has a daughter who is one and a half years old. Erika sells second-hand toys. She buys in bulk and sells by the unit. She has a sales stall in the Villa La Merced area but she also sells at different markets.

This is her first loan from Emprender. She will use the loan to purchase seasonal merchandise for the end of year holidays. She will buy five bundles of toys. Her reason for requesting this loan is her lack of cash since she will be having a lot of sales this season and she wants to stock up on merchandise.

Erika confronts challenges in her business, which include moving from market to market to sell her products. The process generates a sense of insecurity because it is a bit dangerous. She will use the funds to continue buying merchandise. 

Erika is a young person who is eager to continue improving her business. She feels fortunate and is grateful to Emprender for the support provided.

loans.use: to purchase toy merchandise by the bundle.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is 35 years old. She is a widow and takes care of seven children. She will use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer for use during maize production; she needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors to enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has six children who go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents and young sister).  

She has a business of selling of used clothes and has been in this business for 6 years. She applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes such as skirts and blouses. She works at the market seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Margaret aspires to become a wholesaler and to educate her children up to the university level.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of their small loan amounts advanced to members that are easily payable.  She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity, but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man with six children, all of whom go to school. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water.  His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past two years, David has been selling poultry at the market to the general public. The main challenge for his business has been unstable market prices. 

He joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to purchase more chicks for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks for his business.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 68 years old and from Olkalou. He is married to Mary, who assist him in farm work. They are blessed with two children, aged 12 and 18 years old.

Geoffrey has been running his farming business for the last 20 years. He mainly specializes in vegetable growing. To enable him to buy some farm inputs like fertilizers and plant seeds, he has applied for his fifth loan of KES 55,000 from VisionFund Kenya. 

His monthly income right now is KES 25,000 and his plan is to use the profits anticipated from his expanded business to educate his children, pay back his loan to VisionFund Kenya and improve his farming activities. In the future, Geoffrey hopes to be the most successful farmer in his region.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertlizers and plant seeds.

loans.name: Pashke

texts.en:
Pashke is a 53-year-old mother of five children who still attend school. Pashke has worked with livestock for the past ten years. Selling raw milk to residents of a nearby town has been their family’s source of income.

Pashke wants to build a stable with your financial help; the existing stable is seen in the background of the photograph. During her interview, Pashke expressed her worries about her animals now that the winter has already started. Here is what she said: “This is not a stable. My husband and I built this because we had no other means to build a proper one. But this was built for the summer months, not for snowy and cold weather like the one our region faces from early October until the end of May.”

loans.use: to build a stable for her animals.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Doña Marta tiene 37 años de edad y por más de 5 años en compañía de su esposo se ha dedicado al cultivo de granos básicos como el maíz, frijol y hortalizas siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad ya que en su familia es una vocación. Su grado de educación es de primaria incompleto cursando hasta el tercer año ya que sus padres no pudieron apoyarle económicamente. Tiene 4 hijos pero solo dos (mayores) apoyan a sus padres en el trabajo de campo ya que los últimos 2 están pequeños y estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. Sus clientes son los diferentes vecinos, familiares e intermediarios que llegan a la zona para la adquisición del producto el cual consideran como un producto de calidad, higiénico y a muy buen precio para revender. Como desafío que a ella y a la mayoría de agricultores de escasos recursos se les presenta es el alza de los precios sobre los insumos que son utilizados para asistir su producto más el acarreo del mismo hasta la zona donde están sus casas de habitación.  
Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de insumos que ayudaran a la protección de sus cultivos sobre bichos como la mosca blanca, y el gusano de agua plagas que destruyen y carcomen el grano.
Sus planes a futuro poder arreglar ciertas áreas de su casa de habitación como la cocina lugar donde son preparados sus sagrados alimentos pero con muchos deterioros. Como madre de familia lograr que sus hijos se preparen académicamente y sean profesionales con mejores oportunidades y puedan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marta is 37 years old. For more than 5 years she has worked alongside her husband growing basic grains like corn and beans, and vegetables. Her parents are the ones who taught her how to work the land at a very young age because it is her family's vocation. She has an incomplete primary education. She completed up to the third year in school until her parents could no longer support her economically. She has four children, but only two (who are older) support their parents in their work in the fields because the remaining two are very young and they study at the community school. Her customers are her neighbors, family and intermediaries who arrive in this area to acquire products that they consider to be of high quality, hygienic and at a good price for resale. A challenges she faces, along with the majority of farmers with scarce resources, is the high prices of the supplies that they use to support their crops and the hauling of these same items to the area where their homes are. Consequently, today she is seeking financing to purchase supplies that will help protect her crops from bugs like the whitefly and the water worms that destroy and gnaw on the grains. 

Her plans for the future are to repair certain areas of her home, like the kitchen where she prepares their sacred food, which has deteriorated. As the mother of a family she desires that her children will be prepared academically and become professionals with better opportunities and that she can improve their quality of life.

loans.use:
to purchase agricultural supplies to support her
crops of vegetables and basic grains.

loans.name: Gloria Yolanda

texts.es:
Gloria, es soltera, de 20 años de edad, actualmente vive  junto a su familia en el departamento de Sololá. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y para ello cuenta con su tienda en la comunidad donde vive.
Gloria tiene un año de estar realizando esta actividad. Se inclinó por ello porque se dio cuenta que es algo muy rentable, debido a que la gente de su comunidad demanda los productos (frijol, maíz, etc.) que ella vende; a través de esta labor ella genera los ingresos con los cuales puede aportar a la economía de su familia, lo que le llena de mucha satisfacción.
Además de la venta de abarrotes, Gloria  mientras atiende su negocio, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa típica, lo que también le genera otros ingresos que complementan el presupuesto familiar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,500.00 para la compra de más mercadería para su tienda y asi ofrecerles más productos a sus clientes.
Sueña con multiplicar su negocio y poner otras tiendas de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Gloria, 20, is single and currently lives with her family in the department of Sololá.  She makes a living selling groceries in her store in the community where she lives.

Gloria has been doing this job for a year.  She chose it because she realized it's very profitable: the people in her community need the products she sells (beans, corn, etc).  Through this job she generates income and contributes to the family finances, which gives her great satisfaction.

In addition to selling groceries and tending to her business, Gloria makes and sells traditional clothing and generates additional income to supplement the family budget.

Gloria's requesting a loan for 4,500 quetzales [GTQ] to buy more merchandise for her store and offer her customers more products.

She dreams of expanding her business and setting up additional grocery stores.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Nathmiya

texts.en: Nathmiya was born in 1964. She is married and lives in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Wihdat with her husband, who works as an electrician. Nathmiya decided to support her husband in improving their living conditions by starting her project of selling evening dresses 2 years ago. Then, she started to sew dresses herself as this will help her to earn a better profit. Now, Nathmya would like to expand her project by buying a new sewing machine which will make her be more productive and will help her to earn better income. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish, rice and seasonings for resale.

loans.name: Ayla

texts.en:
Ayla is married, has three children, and was a housewife until she was 50 years old.  For the past three years, she has been selling the merchandise of a brand, promoting it at houses, at gatherings of women, and in open bazaars.  Ayla, who has developed herself both economically and socially in these past few years, has managed to meet the needs of her household and her children.  She has turned from a person whose whole life consisted of meeting the wants and needs of her husband and children – for which she almost never left home – to someone who is self-confident and extroverted.  She will be buying more cosmetic merchandise from the brand and selling more to her clients, in order to increase her income, with the help of the loan she hopes to receive from MAYA.  She hopes to provide a promising future for her children.  She wants her children to be able to stand on their own two feet with pride and for that she wants to increase her income and provide her children with the means to achieve such a future.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff  

Evli ve 3 çocuk annesi 50 yaşına kadar hiç çalışmamış ev hanımı olarak yaşamış.  Daha sonra satış zinciri olan markadan 3 yıldır evde, günlerde ve pazarlarda satış yapıyor.  Ekonomik ve sosyal olarak kendini geliştiren ayla ekonomik olarak kendi ihtiyaçlarını, çocuklarının ihtiyaçlarını ve evinin ihtiyaçlarını karşılıyabiliyor. Sosyal olarak daha önce evden dışarı çıkmayan eşinin ve çocuklarının isteklerini karşılayan evinde oturan birisiyken şimdi ise kendine güvenen, dışa dönük bir insan haline gelmiş.  Maya’dan alacağı kredi ile amacı daha fazla ürün(kozmetik) çekip satışını arttırıp kazancını yükseltmek.  Gelecek için planları ve ümitleri çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek sağlamak.  Çocuklarınında kendi ayaklarının üstünde her şeye dimdik ayakta durmasını istiyor bunun için işlerini büyütüp kazancını arttırmayı istiyor.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma has two children. After her husband retired, and Fatma was still a housewife, they opened a shop selling artificial flowers in the Esnaf Sarayı shopping mall.  In their shop, they make home decorations and bridal flowers. Fatma and her husband have put a lot of effort into their business.  A compatriot of theirs, who works in Belgium, bought some bridal flowers from their shop.  After that, she began coming back to Turkey every two months and buying more flowers to resell in Belgium. The flowers made by Fatma and her husband began to make their way to Belgian brides.  

For the menswear brand Sarar, they began making thousands of boutonnieres for men’s suits. With the loan from Maya, Fatma intends to buy more artificial flowers with which she will create different arrangements so that she can increase her orders and sales.  Both of Fatma’s sons have attended university. While at first Fatma and her husband had rented their shop, they have since been able to buy the property. With their future earnings, they hope to pave the way for a good life and future for their children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

2 çocuğu olan Fatma, eşi emekli olduktan sonra kendisi ev hanımıyken eşiyle beraber esnaf sarayında yapma çiçek dükkanı açmışlar.  Dükkanların da ev dekorasyonu ve gelinlik çiçekleri yapıyorlar. Eşiyle beraber çok mücadele vermişler.  Belçika’da çalışan bir gurbetçi dükkanlarından gelinlik çiçekleri almış.  Daha sonra 2  ayda bir Türkiye’ye gelerek gelinlik çiçekleri almaya başlamış.  Yaptıkları gelinlik çiçekleri Belçika’da gelinlere ulaşmaya başlamış.  Erkek giyim markası Sarar’a erkek takım elbiselerine binlerce yaka çiçeği yapmaya başlamışlar.  Maya’dan alacağı kredi ile  amacı dükkanına daha fazla çiçek alıp değişik ürünler yapıp siparişlerini ve satışlarını arttırmayı istiyor.  2 erkek çocuk sahibi 2 çocuğuda üniversiteyi okumuşlar.  Bulundukları dükkan önceleri kira iken şimdi ise mülkünü almışlar.  İlerleyen zamanlarda elde ettikleri gelirlerle çocuklarına iyi bir yaşam ve gelecek hazırlamak istiyorlar.

loans.use: to buy flowers

loans.name: Gülşah

texts.en:
Gülşah, a newlywed, worked for six years at a hair salon. She started as regular apprentice and left when she became hairdresser. As time passed, she became a professional in the field and decided to open her own shop. 

Five years ago she rented a small shop with some financial support from her family.  After three years, with her hard work and ambition, she transformed her little shop into a bigger beauty center and hair design salon.  Now, with the loan she will receive from Maya, she will purchase personal beauty products needed for her business. This way, she will be able to serve a wider range of customers and earn more.  She has hopes and plans for the future.  She is planning to make her business a national and international brand and create franchises.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Yeni evlenen Gülşah 6 yil boyunca bir kuaförde eleman olarak girip daha sonra çırak olarak çalışmış.  Zaman ilerledikçe önce çırak devamında usta olmuş ve kendi dükkanını açmaya karar vermiş.  5 yıl önce küçük bir dükkan kiralamış .  Küçük bir sermayesi ve ailesinin desteği ile dükkanını açmış.  3 yıl boyunca çok çalışıp çalışkanlığı hırsı ve azmi ile güzellik merkezi ve kuaför salonu olarak büyük bir dükkan açmış.  Şimdi ise Maya’dan alacaği kredi ile kuaför dükkanına kişisel bakım ürünleri ve kuaför alanında gerekli olan malzemeleri alacak.  Böylece daha fazla müşteri ve daha fazla gelir elde etmek istiyor.  Gelecek için planları ve ümitleri var.  Güzellik merkezini marka yapmak Türkiye de ve dünya da  francay olarak vermek.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a borrower of Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. She has requested for a Kiva loan for her husband. He is a motor mechanic by profession. This is the only source of income for his family. 

Presently, Allah Rakhi's husband needs to purchase a variety of tools for the shop for repairing motor vehicles. The existing tools are too old. This Kiva loan requested by his wife will be helpful for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. Allah Rakhi dreams for the success of her husband. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools for the workshop.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 37-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a hawker and sells fruits in their hometown. He goes to the fruit market daily to buy fresh fruits such as apples, pineapples, bananas, oranges, guavas, etc. He is very famous in the community due to his polite behavior and the freshness of his fruits. He has been selling fruits for many years. Because of his business, he understands the mind and demand of people. To cope with the demand; he wants to buy more fruits. In this way he will be able to fulfill the demand and can easily get more profit.

Therefore, Sajida requested a loan so her husband would be able to buy more fruits, especially oranges. This is Sajida's first loan.She promises that she will pay all installments on time because she wants to take out a large loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy seasonal and fresh fruits to sell

loans.name: Nazeeh

texts.en: Nazeeh is a married man who was born in 1982. He has 1 son. Nazeeh has been trying his best to cover his family's needs and to provide his son with the best education by running his project of selling clothes in his own store for the past 3 years. As it is now winter season, he would like to add a new collection of winter clothes, which might attract more customers, in addition to adding children clothes to respond to his customers’ requests. This step will raise his sales and profit significantly. But, he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase children clothes and winter clothes for his store.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 23 years old. He would like to use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 34 years old, married, and has two children. He is from Olkalou. He is a wheat farmer, which he has been doing for three years. His monthly income is 30,000 KES.

George requested his fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya for 70,000 KES, which he will use to buy pesticides, herbicides, and fertilizer. He plans to use the profits anticipated from his expanded business to pay back his loan and to educate his children. In the future, George hopes to be a very successful farmer.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides, herbicides, and fertilizer

loans.name: Florentino

texts.en:
Florentino, age 40, is a certified organic cacao farmer of the village of Red Bank. He manages his 3,000 mature cacao trees. Florentino, together with his wife, Eustachia, raised their seven children. Eustachia mostly spends her time doing crafting and attending to her children. 

Florentino got motivated to farm cacao with the help of his Dad. He said that cacao farming has been the best because there is a stable market to sell his cacao beans with money directly received. “Maya Mountain Cacao has given me a lot of support in properly managing my cacao farm,” he stated. He also cultivates different types of cash crops such as beans, corn, etc. He also has a small business and guest house, and he takes tourists out for Scarlet Macaw watching. This work requires his time, which leaves him with less time to cultivate his cacao farm. 

Florentino is requesting this loan to hire workers to continue cleaning around his trees to keep them free from pests and disease, and to aid harvesting. He said with the help of this loan he will be able to complete most of his work. 

His future goal is to educate his children to get professional jobs, so one day they will be able to assist him on his farm. He will continue to expand. His plan this year coming is to plant 1,000 new grafted trees.

loans.use: To clean the brush from under 3,000 cacao trees.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en:
Lucio, age 62, is an organic cacao farmer from the beautiful village of San Anotnio.  Lucio, together with his wife, Apolinaira, raised three children.  Apolinaria is a house wife and enjoys her time harvesting and selling cacao to MMC. 

Lucio got encouragement to plant cacao trees with assistance from the Ministry of Agriculture in late 1986.  Lucio stated that cacao is a permanent crop that does not require much attention except for upkeep.  He presently manages a small grocery store which takes up most of his time. His wife, Apolinaria, complains about the overgrown weeds whenever she goes to harvest. Together they also cultivate different types of crops such as corn, beans, plantain, yams and some fruit trees,  They are all for human consumption.  Lucio says the monilla tree (Mexican Buckeye) is a challenge to control and it requires too much of his time to properly treat his farm to prevent pests, weeds and disease.

Lucio is requesting this loan to hire a person to properly treat his cacao trees to keep them free from pests, weeds and disease so he can increase his yield.

Lucio future goal is to expand more on grafted cacao trees.  He presently has an adopted son he is encouraging to get more education and find a professional job.

loans.use: to hire a person to properly treat his 2000 cacao trees to keep them free from pests, weeds and disease so he can increase his yield.

loans.name: Hülya

texts.en:
Hulya, mother of two, first started her career helping her husband at the shoe and clothing store he opened. Now she stays at the shop all day and takes care of its issues, including sales and purchases, herself. Hulya, who receives a lot of business, aims to expand the business and open a more extensive store. She believes she can expand the business steadily. With the loan from Maya, she will increase the variety of shoes at the store. She plans to increase sales and her income in this way. Her dream is to give her children a positive future and a nice life with the money she earns from the store.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

2 çocuk annesi olan hülya ilk olarak iş hayatına eşinin açmış olduğu ayakkabı ve giyim mağazasın da eşine yardımcı olmak amacıyla başlamıştır. Şimdiler de ise bütün gün dükkan da durup dükkanın tüm ihtiyaçlarını kendisi karşılıyor. Tüm gün dükkan da durup satışı ve mal alışını kendisi üstlenmektedir.Çok yoğun bir şekilde müşterisi olan hülya işlerini iyice büyütüp daha geniş çaplı dükkan açmayı hedefliyor. Dükkanını istikrarlı bir şekilde büyüteceğine inanıyor. Maya’dan alacağı kredi ile dükkanın da ayakkabı çeşidini arttırmak istiyor. Böylece satışı ve elde ettiği geliri arttırmayı planlıyor.Hayali ise dükkanından sağladığı kazanç ile çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek ve güzel yaşam sağlamak hedefinde.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Meral

texts.en:
Meral is the mother of two children. She operates a flower shop with her husband on Sair Fuzuli Avenue. She started working as a florist with her husband when she married.  Before that, she didn’t know anything about flowers. She learned the details of this work from her husband and other florists.  Her customers are people from all walks of life.  People send flowers and wreaths for special occasions.  She has one son in university and a daughter in high school. With the loan from Maya, she will buy a larger variety of flowers.  Because her customers are all types of people, she thinks a bigger variety of flowers will attract more clients. She and her husband share the goal of a bright future for their children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

2 çocuk annesi olan Meral’ın ; şair fuzuli caddesinde eşiyle birlikte çalıştırdığı canlı çiçek dükkanları var. Evlendikten sonra eşiyle beraber çiçekcilik yapmaya başlamış.  Önceleri canlı çiçekle ilgili hiç bilgisi yokmuş eşinden ve diğer çiçekci dükkanlarının vitrinlerini dolaşarak bu işin inceliklerini  öğrenmiş.  Müşterileri her kesimden insana hitap ediyor.  Kamudan özel günler için çiçek ve çelenk gönderiyolar.  1 oğlu üniversite 1 kızı ise lisede okuyor.  Maya’dan alacağı kredi ile çiçek dükkanın da alacağı canlı çiçek çeşidini arttırmak istiyor.  Alacağı çiçekler her kesimden müşteriye hitap ettiği için görünüşü ve çeşidiyle daha çok müşterisi olacağına inanıyor.  Eşiyle beraber hedefleri ise kızı ve oğluna iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyolar.

loans.use: to buy flowers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more yams to expand her business.

loans.name: Mükerrem

texts.en:
Mukerrem, mother of four, began her career working for others. Later, by saving a small sum from her workplace, she was able to open her own business selling underwear and women’s clothing.  She goes to the city market to sell her products.  First she used her income to repay her debts.  Raising four children, Mukerrem is driven, hardworking, and determined. She has plans and hopes for the future. With a loan from Maya, she will obtain more products for her business. In this way she plans to increase her customers and profit.  Her first goal is to expand her current business and increase her earnings.  In this way she wants to provide a good future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

4 çocuk annesi olan Mükerrem çalışma hayatına önce başkalarının yanında çalışarak başlamış.  Sonra,iç çamaşırı ve kadın giysisi satmaya başlamış.  Semt pazarlarına gidip,burada mallarını satıyor.  Daha sonra çalıştığı yerde ufak bir birikim sağlayarak kendisine küçük bir işletme açmış.  Önceliklikle sağladığı kazançla borçlarını kapatmış.  4 çocuğunu yetiştiren Mükerrem hırslı, çalışkan ve azimli bir bayan.  Gelecek ile ilgili planları ve ümitleri var.  Maya’dan alacağı kredi ile dükkanına daha fazla ürün temin edecek.  Böylece müşteri kapasitesini arttırmakla birlikte kazancını yükseltmeyi planlıyor.  Öncelikle ilk hedefi ise şu an ki işletmesinden daha büyük bir yer açmak ve işlerini kazancını büyütmek.  Bu sayede de çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek temin etmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products for her business

loans.name: Neelam

texts.en: Neelam is a 32-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a vegetable shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of seasonal vegetables in his shop such as tomatoes, potatoes, peas, carrots, onions, etc .Presently he is interested in offering more variety to his customers for the winter season, which will help him increase his net income as well as his savings. However, due to a lack of finances, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Neelam has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband purchase a variety of vegetables from the field and sell them in the market at profitable prices. With the profit, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Neelam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase variety of vegetables for the winter season

loans.name: Verido

texts.en:
Verido, age 56, is an organic cacao farmer; he lives in the beautiful village of Santa Cruz. Verido, along with his wife Hilaria, raised his nine children. Most of his children are living out and have their own family. Hilaria spends most of her time on the farm.

Verido got inspired planting cacao from his fellow farmers. He was motivated by the outcome of the cash in hand when Maya Mountain Cacao Staff purchase freshly harvested cacao from the farm to the scale. Verido also cultivates different types of cash crops. He presently lives on his farm with his wife and two daughters.

Verido is requesting this loan to hire workers to properly clean his farm. For him to get high yields his farm requires maintenance. He insists that it needs proper care and maintenance, so he is planning to hire workers to assist him in clearing out the underbrush below his trees. 

He further envisions having a larger farm than he has now and to allow his daughter to manage it in the future. He also plans on sending his children to become educated and get professional jobs.

loans.use: To clean out underbrush from 2 acres of mature cacao trees.

loans.name: Perihan

texts.en:
Perihan is divorced and is a devoted mother of three children. At first she did women's eyebrows for money at her house and sold things she knitted. With her earnings, she paid for her daughter’s wedding. She increased her income by developing her knitting skills, creating items with different models for her friends and her neighborhood.  She believes that she will increase her sales by producing many more different kinds of knitting products with the help of the loan from Maya.  The loan from Maya will help Perihan increase her sales and she plans to increase her income.  Her future dream is, after her son completes his military obligations and returns, to open a shop for him and have him sell her products so that she will have more time for knitting new products. She wants to grow her business with her son and better support her children. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

3 çocuk annesi olan Perihan eşinden ayrılmış ve hayatını çocuklarına adamış bir bayan.  Önceleri evinde bayanların kaşlarını alarak ve örgü örerek çocuklarına kazanç sağlamış.  Sağladığı kazancı ile  1 kızını evlendirmiş.  Örgü de kendini ilerleten ve sürekli farklı modellerle arkadaşlarına, kendi çevresine ve arkadaşlarının çevresine satış yaparak gün geçtikçe gelirini biraz daha fazla artırmış.  Maya’dan alacağı kredi ile ürün temin edip daha farklı modeller örerek satış oranını arttıracağına inanıyor.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi Perihan’ın satışının artmasında destek olduğu gibi sağlayacağı gelirinde artmasını planlıyor.  İleride ki hayali ise oğlu askerden geldikten sonra bir dükkan açarak el örgülerini satışa sunmak istiyor.  Çok fazla satış yapan Perihan kendi yetişemediği için oğlu ile birlikte dükkanın başında durarak kazancı arttırmak, işini büyütmek ve çocuklarına daha iyi bir destek sağlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy knitting supplies

loans.name: Placido

texts.en:
The loan really assists Placido in his farm. He went to borrow from a bank, but he never got any assistance that way, and he thanks Maya Mountain Cacao (MMC) for their kindness in giving farmers loans.

Placido, age 57, is an organic cacao farmer. He lives in the beautiful village of Pueblo Viejo. This village is one of the remote villages, with no access to electricity. Placido, together with his wife, Florentina, raised nine children, of whom two still live with their parents.

Placido started planting cacao the hard way; he got seed from his dad and began planting on his own. He stated that corn and beans don’t bring as much income as cacao production. Cacao is a permanent crop that only requires proper cleaning, he says. He also cultivates different types of crops, such as corn, beans and rice, and he keeps cattle. Cattle and farming cacao are the easiest, Placido says. He presently has his own business shop.

Placido is requesting this loan to hire workers, who will assist him in properly cleaning his cacao farm. Presently, he faces no challenges with pests or disease.

Placido's future goals are to expand by many more cacao trees and to retire from farming. He hopes that one day, one of his children will take over the farming.

loans.use: to properly clean his cacao trees

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago, age 58, is an organic cacao farmer. He lives in the beautiful village of Red Bank, which lies between the South Stann Creek and Toledo. Santiago and his wife, Juana, raised their seven children, of whom five are still living with them. The other children have some sort of employment. His wife, Juana, spends most of her time attending to the children.

Santiago was inspired to plant cacao by the advisory of Agriculture from Guatemala, and his fellow farmers' advice. He manages his 1500 cacao trees up-to-date. Santiago holds outside employment, as well, which gives him limited time to properly clean his farm. Rain has been a challenge, he stated; the weeds grow too fast for him to control. His favorite of all is picking ripe pods and selling the product. Santiago also cultivates different types of crops for home consumption.

Santiago is requesting this loan to hire workers to clean his cacao trees. With this loan he would be able to have his cacao farm clean and continue his other employment, and his family will be happy at home.

Santiago's future goal is to expand with more cacao trees. He also wants to support his children financially, to get some level of education and find professional jobs.

loans.use: to clean and properly maintain his 1500 organic cacao trees, while continuing his other employment.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa, age 50, is a female organic cacao farmer, who lives in the beautiful village of Laguna. Rosa, a single parent, has been struggling her way through raising her eight children. Now, most of them are employed and working. Rosa is a very ambitious person and works tirelessly; she is involved in tourism and small business, in addition to farming.

Rosa stated that her husband had started this cacao farm, before they separated. She now stays in charge of maintaining the farm, along with her children. She does inter-cropping farm techniques, which bring her money to feed her children and enable her to save a little income. Rosa enjoys working and growing cacao, because of its production and the income she earns for the family in this activity. She enjoys harvesting; however, last year the result was negative due to black pods in her cacao.

Rosa is requesting this loan to hire workers, to assist her in properly cleaning and managing the farm. This work will keep the farm free from disease, so the trees can be productive.

She plans to expand her farm in the future, and to continue planting more cacao plants. In this way, she will be able to continue to sustain her family and the market. She is, further, motivated to get her children educated, especially in tourism. Her cacao farm is used as a tourist destination.

loans.use: to hire workers, to properly clean the organic cacao farm.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe, age 59, is an organic cacao farmer who lives in the village of San Jose, where he manages his 3 acres of mature cacao trees. Felipe and his wife, Reymunda, raised their ten children, one of whom still lives with them. Reymunda spends most of her time doing crafts and harvesting cacao pods.

Felipe got motivated to farm cacao with his purchase of cacao seedlings from the Ministry of Agriculture. “It’s a permanent and profitable crop. Farming is good; all you need is cleaning. Farmers like to plant cacao as, when harvested, the sale price is good,” Felipe states. Felipe also cultivates different types of crops such as corn, beans, rice and a small vegetable garden to sustain his family's needs. "Farming is my life," he states. "All my income is from farming and the majority is cacao."

Felipe is requesting this loan to hire workers to assist him in cleaning his mature cacao trees and some underbrush for planting additional grafted seedlings this coming season.

Felipe's future goal is to expand with more cacao seedlings to continue receiving a high income and high production from his crops. He says that he wants his goal in farming to be achieved with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to properly clean 1,000 mature cacao trees

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 26-year-old single man who is responsible for six members of his family. Raed has been employed in a construction company and has specialized in internal decorations for the past nine years. He was only 16 years old when started working to financially support his family and he is their sole bread winner.

Raed is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to make necessary maintenance to his family's house in order to keep it a healthy living place. In addition he will build an extra room for his family's increasing needs.

He hopes that in the future he will be capable of starting his own business, which he has always dreamed about. He wants to be a DJ and is working hard to make his dream come true.

loans.use: to make necessary improvements to his family's house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients including meat, plantains, oil, condiments, and rice.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
For the last 10 years Tabitha, 41 years old, has been running a business of maize farming in Nyahururu. She is a single mother of five children ages 19, 18, 13, 9 and 6 years.

To enable her to hire some laborers to assist her with maize cob harvesting and to buy some planting seeds, she has applied for her second loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES 8,000 and her intention is to use the profits anticipated from her expanded business to educate her children. In the future, Tabitha hopes and dreams of being a very successful farmer.

loans.use: To hire laborers to assist with harvesting maize cob and to buy planting seeds

loans.name: Colón Cristobal

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San José se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive don Colon, tiene 56 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tiene diez hijos, 9 mayores de edad y el menor de 16 años que estudia en colegio, dos de ellos aun  viven en su casa. Su esposa es ama de casa.
Don Colón es sastre de profesión, profesión que aprendió hace muchos años atrás, tiene un taller de costura donde se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para caballeros y niños, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que conocen de la calidad de sus obras, aunque en temporadas también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar. Lleva más de 35 años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual ha sacado adelante a sus hijos y su familia. 
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva 4 ciclos  del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "San José" meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo. This area is known for its beautiful beaches that line the coast of this lovely place. Most of the residents are hard workers who are devoted to jobs related to the sea.

Don Colón lives in this place. He is 56 years old, married, and has 10 children. Nine of them are adults and the youngest is 16 years old and a high school student. Two of his children still live at home. His wife is a homemaker.

Don Colón is a tailor by profession. He learned this profession many years ago. Don Colón has a tailoring shop where he makes all types of clothes for men and children. He works according to the orders he receives from specific individuals who are familiar with the quality of his work. Don Colón also has seasonal work since he makes uniforms for institutions, elementary schools, and high schools in the area. He works every day from 6:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. Sometimes he works much later whenever he has orders that need to be delivered. Don Colón has been in this profession for more than 35 years and it has enabled his children and his family to get ahead.

This new loan will be used to buy fabrics and other sewing materials. He has participated in four loan cycles with his Communal Bank and enjoys being a member because the help the loans have provided have allowed him to move forward. His dreams include continuing to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, está acompañada, vive junto a su compañero de vida, para aportar económicamente a los gastos de su hogar por iniciativa propia aprendió el oficio de la costura, la cual ejerce desde hace 20 años, tiene un horario de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., dependiendo de la demanda de sus clientes. Por el momento ha podido manejar su negocio sin ningún problema.
Solicita capital para invertir en la compra de telas, hilos, zippers, botones, algunos repuestos para la maquina y también le dará mantenimiento al equipo, espera que al contar con lo necesario para elaborar sus pedidos podrá tener clientes más satisfechos, mayores ganancias, con las que podar cancelar las cuotas y cubrirá gastos de su hogar.
Sueña con tener una sastrería mucho más amplia y bien equipada para dar una buena atención al público que hace uso de sus servicios.
texts.en:
María lives with her life companion. She learned how to sew at her own initiative in order to contribute economically to household expenses  She has been a seamstress for 20 years and keeps a 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. work schedule, depending on client demand. At the moment, she has been able to manage her business without any problems.

She is requesting capital to purchase fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, a few parts for her machine and also to provide maintenance for her equipment. She hopes that having all she needs to fulfill her orders will result in more satisfied customers and greater profits. Thus she will be able to repay her debts and cover household expenses. She dreams of having a much bigger and better equipped tailoring shop so that she can provide good service to the public that makes use of her services.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Shoghik

texts.en:
Shoghik is from Dalarik village of Armavir region. She lives with her husband, 7-year-old daughter, 3-year-old son, parents-in-law, and brother-in-law. 

Shoghik is employed in the government sector; she works as a teacher at the village local school. Her husband is a policeman, her mother-in-law is also a teacher in the same school, and her brother-in-law works in the private sector. All the family works hard to be able to cover their daily expenses. However, their salaries are so low that it is almost impossible to afford a living based on those salaries alone. Shoghik and her family members are also involved in cattle breeding, in breeding pigs and piglets, and in the cultivation of alfalfa, peaches and apricots. The family sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of their income.

To continue running the agribusiness in a sustainable way, Shoghik needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase five steers, to buy forage for the livestock, and to purchase fertilizers. Shoghik and her large family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase five steers, buy forage for the livestock, and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with five children and three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for 8 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income through selling vegetables.  She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.

She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to get enough profits so as to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted to acquire more capital. Her monthly expenses include school and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 60 years old. He is married with two children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use during maize production

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is an experienced farmer from Apaga village of Armavir region. Her family consists of her husband, daughter and son. Aida's husband has migrated to Russia as a labor migrant; he works there and sends money to the family to take care of their needs. Aida is engaged in the cultivation of greens and grapes. Her daughter and son help her sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income.

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Aida needs a loan of 2,000 USD to purchase necessary materials for greenhouse construction (cellophane, bottles), and to buy fertilizers. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Aida was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments.

So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Aida and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials for greenhouse construction (cellophane, bottles), and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, se decidió por otro crédito para comprar maíz, verduras y frutas, para sacar provecho en esta temporada navideña y tener más ingresos también de esta manera podrá fortalecer su negocio.
El efecto que le dio el crédito anterior fue muy positivo ya que su negocio creció, tiene una economía más estable y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado mucho.
texts.en:
María decided to request another loan in order to buy corn, vegetables, and fruits so that she can take advantage of the Christmas season and generate more income. This will also allow her to strengthen her business.

The effect of her previous loan was very positive since her business grew and provided a more stable financial situation. Her family circumstances greatly improved.

loans.use: to buy corn, vegetables, and fruits.

loans.name: Nyundo

texts.en:
Nyundo is a hard-working and enterprising man. He is married with four children, all of whom go to school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nyundo operates a carpentry business, selling workshop tools such as pliers, hacksaws, nails and grease among others. He cites price fluctuation as his major challenge.

With the KES 15,000 loan he wants to purchase nails, paint, timber and workshop tools for his business. He joined Yehu to get financial support.
