loans.use: to purchase nails, paint, timber and workshop tools for his business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has an Internet café business in the Philippines.

Nenita requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional computer for her business.

Nenita has been in this business for three years now.

Nenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sandals, blouses and slacks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blouses, trousers, and a variety of clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food items like drinks, flour, cooking oil, palm oil, and cooking seasoning for resale

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is 35-year-old lady living with her three children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She owns a general store at home; she has allotted a portion of her house for the general store. One of her drawing rooms opens through the front side in the street--she is utilizing that room for the general store. She offers many items such as rice, flour, pulses, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits. 

She has been running this business for many years and this is the major source of income for her family because her earnings are very poor. Now she wants to grow her business in increments for the needs of her family. So she decided to grow her business and contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan.

She will buy rice, flour, pulses, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits. She hopes that her general store would work better than earlier.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, pulses, flour, and detergent for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, onion, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Dayhanna Alexandra

texts.es:
Ella es dayhanna, siempre ha querido estudiar mercadeo y ventas, le ha sido muy difícil por motivos económicos ya que vive con la mama y los hermanos menores, Dayhanna con mucho esfuerzo logro matricularse para el curso de mercadeo y ventas, logro cursar el primer semestre, pero ya el segundo le fue imposible seguirlo hasta ahora que con esfuerzo puede seguir el curso para poder culminar el curso.
Dayhanna sueña con poder culminar el curso de mercadeo y ventas, quiere crecer  profesionalmente para poder cumplir las metas  y poder ayudarle a la mama con los hermanos, quiere colaborar con el estudio, no quiere que le pase lo mismo a los hermanos, quiere una buena educación que puedan estudiar sin complicaciones y san hombres de bien, porque la mama es la que responde por ellos y le es muy difícil darles una buena educación.
Dayhanna quiere en un futuro estar bien, ser una profesional, con un buen empleo, respondiendo por los hermanos, estudiando, saliendo adelante junto con la mama y que no pasen dificultades como lo tuvieron en el pasado, al igual dayhanna quiere seguir estudiando mercadeo y ventas, este curso es una buena ayuda para poder entrar a la universidad y seguir creciendo profesionalmente, necesita el convenio con kiva, ya que es un modo fácil de pagar las cuotas de su semestre.
texts.en:
This is Dayhanna. She has always wanted to study marketing and sales. It has been very difficult, however, due to financial reasons, since she still lives with her mother and younger brothers. With much effort Dayhanna was able to enroll in a marketing and sales course and to finish the first semester. However it was impossible for her to continue with the second semester and she is still trying to finish the program.

Dayhanna dreams of being able to finish her marketing and sales classes and wants to grow professionally so that she can meet her goals and be in a position to help her mother with her brothers. She wants to help them with their studies since she does not want the same thing to happen to them.  She wants them to have a good education and to study without complications and become fine, upstanding men. Her mother is the person who supports them and it is very difficult for her to provide a good education, as well.

Dayhanna wants to have a good future and to become a professional with a good job. Then she can help to support her brothers in their studies and she and her mother can get ahead together and avoid the problems that have plagued them in the past. As well Dayhanna wants to continue studying marketing and sales. This course is a good stepping stone to the university and to continuing to grow professionally. She needs this agreement with Kiva because it is an easy way to pay for her school semester.

loans.use: to pay registration fees for one semester.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a single mother with four children, three are school-aged. She also takes care of additional family members (a mother and grandmother). She has been in the snack selling business for 2 years. Annet has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cooking oil, baking powder and flour.  She generates additional income from teaching part time .  She works in a shop and sells wholesale seven days each week.  

Her major business challenges include increasing prices of cooking oil and other ingredients.  She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and to buy a plot of land and build a house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, baking powder, and flour.

loans.name: Alafia A Group

texts.en:
For the second time, Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of the “Alafia A” group. Their previous Kiva loan has been very helpful in boosting their respective businesses. 

Having done repaying their last Kiva loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each member in the group in order to further expand their respective businesses. 

Featured leader, Fatmata, will again use her share of the loan to buy rice, palm-oil, tomatoes, pepper, onions, gari (food made out of cassava roots), etc. to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm-oil, tomatoes, pepper, onions, gari, etc.

loans.name: Syombua

texts.en:
Syombua is 41 years old and married. She and her husband have been blessed with four children.  Syombua has a fruit and vegetable business in Kangundo town.  Her spouse provides additional income for the family. 

She will use this loan to buy more mangoes to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to pay her children's school fees, repay the loan, and provide for the needs of her family. 

This is her second loan and she successfully repaid her previous loan. In the future, she hopes to expand her business by opening a grocery shop to make more income and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tilapia and feed.

loans.name: Phillison's Group

texts.en:
Phillison is a member of Inama Group in Chwele District.  He is pictured here in a group of 4 One Acre Fund farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 40 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Phillison has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving inputs for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Phillison is married and has 5 children.  He is 46 years old and is known as a friendly and an experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group and burial committee.  Phillison has been a farmer for 20 years.  Phillison described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Phillison first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Phillison joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices and earn enough to feed family.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, wants to help more farmers and also spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Phillison plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and invest in a business.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Phillison’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest and was able to feed the family.

Phillison and the Inama Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Marys Consuelo

texts.es:
Marys, es una señora que vive con su hija de 16 años de edad, es divorciada, no posee ayuda del extranjero, se dedica a vender ropa, es un oficio que aprendió de familia, tiene una experiencia de cuatro años en ese ámbito, lo hace de manera independiente, trabaja de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 5:30 p.m.
Solicita un préstamo con el objetivo de surtir su inventario, comprará ropa, como blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisas, trajes para niños y niñas, espera que le ayude a tener clientes más satisfechos, brindar un buen servicio, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su economía para cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas.
Sueño con adquirir una casa propia y dar a su hija estudios universitarios, así como también una mejor vida familiar.
texts.en:
Marys is a lady who lives with her 16 year old daughter. She is divorced and cannot rely on anyone else for help. She sells clothing. It is a job she learned from her family. She has four years of experience and works independently. She works from 6 a.m. until 5:30 p.m.

She is requesting a loan to stock her inventory. She will buy clothing, such as blouses, skirts, pants, shirts and outfits for boys and girls. She expects that it will help her have more satisfied clients, provide better service, increase sales and improve her finances so she can promptly repay her debts.

She dreams of owning a house and giving her daughter a university education and thus also improving her family life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, such as blouses, skirts, pants, shirts and other garments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosita requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, etc. for her food vending business. She has been in this business for the past six years.She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her food vending business. In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 46-year-old married woman with eight children, four of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nida has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for twenty years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell.

In the future, Nida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 28 years old and from Naivasha. She is married with two children.

Catherine has a hotel business that she has been running for the past two years. She has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her buy more chairs to add to her hotel.

She hopes to own the biggest hotel in her area.

loans.use: to enable her buy chairs to use in her hotel

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 52 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Thelma has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks like wallet, pouches, blankets, etc., to sell.

Thelma has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like wallets, pouches, blankets, etc., to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Fatma Dilek

texts.en: Fatma is divorced and has one child. Fifteen years ago she started making authentic embroidery inspired by Turkish themes as a hobby. She made bedspreads and covers for bedroom furniture. Later on she tried this embroidery on jewelry. She made various kinds of bracelets and rings. After a while she started her own business. She would get orders from her customers and sell her products. She improved her work and started making accessories for home decoration. When there were no orders, she continued to produce items and sold them wherever she went.  With the help of the loan she will buy various strings, demse strings (glow in the dark) and accessories.  Part of the loan will be used to create a website on which her products will be displayed. Her sales will increase because the number of accessories for her creations will increase. Right now she cannot buy anything because she does not have any capital. With the help of this loan she will be able to buy the items she needs and complete her orders and sell them. In the future, she wants to increase her capital and open a store. She wants to present her products to the public and also employ other women.  She wants to guarantee her child's future and enable her child to complete a full education. She also wants to found a trademark.

loans.use: to buy various strings, demse strings (glow in the dark) and accessories

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is a 56-year-old from Nyandarua South. She is married with five children who are aged between 8 years and 20 years old.

She is a farmer and has been in this business for many years. She has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use on her farm. 

She hopes to get a bigger loan and improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is forty six years old, married to Laban, and a mother of five children. She sells second hand clothing in Kangemi and has been in this business for seven years. Her monthly income is eighteen thousand shillings.

This will be Ruth's eight loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to buy clothes for resale, Ruth wants to improve her family's living standard in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 58-year-old lady and the mother of six children. One of her daughters owns a tailoring business at home and sews clothes for the ladies of her hometown. Her husband is an old man and does not do any job. 

Her daughter started the tailoring business as per the needs of her family. She uses a local sewing machine, which works manually and is very slow. Due to the low speed, she has lot of pending work to complete. Without a speedy machine, it seems impossible to sew clothes on time.

Therefore, Irshad requested a loan to buy a Juki sewing machine so that her daughter can sew clothes in a specific time. She expects that with the help of a new machine, she can complete her tasks in a very short time.

loans.use: to buy a Juki sewing machine for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase for her business, more palm oil, salt, meat, fish, onion, etc.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 34 year old farmer who farms in Muranga area of Central Kenya.  He is married and has 2 school-aged children.  Farming has provided his livelihood for 5 years.  He produces and sells milk, eggs, tea, and a few small crops to sell in the local market. He enjoys dairy farming and milking the cows.

Lawrence chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer very good services, and provide loans at a low interest rate.  He also learned that in order to have economic growth, one must also develop a lifestyle of saving.  This loan will enable Lawrence to irrigate his crops because he will have a water tank to store enough water.  This will help his crops produce more and will increase his income base.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Felecien

texts.en:
Felecien is a 39-year-old father of six children. He would like to use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer to grown maize.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to grow maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy embroidery materials.

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.en: Lyudmila is from the village of Dalarik of the Armavir region. She lives with her daughter. Lyudmila is employed in the government sector; she is an emergency nurse. Her salary, however, is so low that she cannot afford a living based on that salary alone. To cover her family's costs, Lyudmila, with the help of her daughter, is also engaged in breeding a livestock of steers and piglets. As life is getting more expensive with time, Lyudmila wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit to more effectively address her family's needs. A loan of 1,300 USD will help her greatly, enabling her to purchase two steers, to buy some forage for the livestock, and to make previous credit repayments. Lyudmila and her daughter rely on the goodwill of lenders and will be thankful to them for their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain her agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two steers, to buy some forage for the livestock, and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Felix's Group

texts.en:
Felix is a member of the Bidii farmers Group in the Busia District.  He is pictured here in a group of nine One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 71 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Felix has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Felix is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with five children.  Felix is 45 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last five years to support his family.  In addition to this, Felix is involved in the prayer group.  He described his harvest last year as one not with One Acre Fund.  He hopes that as a One Acre Fund farmer he is able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program!							

Felix is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 long rain season. Felix joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative.  Felix plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Felix’s own life was improved because he has more farm training.  	
						
Felix and the Bidii farmers Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
	
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is an experienced farmer from Tandzut village of Armavir region. She lives with her husband and her elderly pensioner mother-in-law. To take care of the family's needs, Aida is extensively engaged in agribusiness with the help of her husband. They are involved in aviculture and in the cultivation of tomatoes, peppers, melons, watermelons, cherries and grapes. Aida and her husband sell their agricultural products in the local market. This is the main source of income for the family. Both of them work really hard to be able to make ends meet. 

Aida cultivates plants in greenhouses and currently needs to make some investments in this sphere to be able to continue plant cultivation productively. A loan of $1,500 US will be huge support for this hardworking woman and her family, enabling her to purchase cellophane for the greenhouse, some fertilizers and special drugs for the plants, and fuel for the greenhouses. 

Aida and her family rely on the goodwill of lenders and will appreciate their support of this loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase cellophane for the greenhouse, some fertilizers and special drugs for the plants and fuel for the greenhouses

loans.name: Matanat

texts.en:
Matanat is 39 years old and married, with three children. Her husband is a bus driver. One of her children is a student of University; another child is 15 years old and goes to ninth class, and the third goes to seventh class. 

Matanat has been in sheep breeding for a long time. Matanat buys lambs, raises them, and sells them to the butcher to earn money. Today she needs AZN 2,300 to buy more lambs for her business. 

Matanat says she is thankful to the partner of Komak company, the Kiva organization, for the aid. In the future she wants to build a new and big stall to  increase her business and monthly income.

loans.use: to buy more lambs

loans.name: Anar

texts.en: Anar is 26 years old, married, and has a child. Now he lives with his family in the Baku region. His wife is a housewife; she take care her baby. Anar has been a master for five years. He builds and repairs homes and walls of yard. Today Anar needs a loan amount of 1,700 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to buy equipment, stone, etc. He has applied for a loan from the Komak company. Anar hopes that this loan will be better for his business. He is thankful to Kiva and the lenders for their help. In the future he wants to hire an assistant to increase his business.

loans.use: he wants to buy equipments, stone, etc

loans.name: Pathmos Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Bufole est une commerçante avec une expérience de 4 ans et leader d’un groupe d’Affaires « Pathmos ». La cliente est  senior, âgée de 50 ans et mère de 9 enfants dont 4 étudient et 5 autres enfants sont déjà  mariés et responsables de leurs foyers. La cliente est vendeuse de boissons sucrées.  Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de l’IMF Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 9 casiers de boissons sucrées (Fanta, coca). Son conjoint est un chauffeur auprès d’une compagnie commerciale. Elle avait commencé son entreprise avec le fonds (prêt) reçu de l’IMF Hekima. Elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur donnant de crédit sans garantie matérielle,  surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Bufole is a merchant with four years' experience and the leader of the "Pathmos" group. She is a senior, aged 50, and a mother of nine children, of whom four go to school. The other five children are already married and responsible for their own households. Her husband is a driver with a commercial company. 

Bufole sells soft drinks. She started this business with a loan that she received from the micro-finance institution Hekima. [Now] she is seeking a loan with Hekima to increase her business. She is going to buy nine cases of soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-cola).

Bufole would like to see her children educated.

She thanks Hekima for their support to female entrepreneurs who do not have access to traditional financial services by providing loans without requiring collateral, especially during this time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy nine cases of soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-cola)

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad, a 35-year-old married father of two babies, has been working in aluminum-manufacturing for 18 years. A Palestinian refugee, he started this kind of work to support his parents. In December of 2012, Mohamad established his current business, and he is working hard to develop it properly to improve his socioeconomic situation.

Mohamad is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy an important newly released aluminum-pressing machine. He is looking forward to acquiring it in order to develop his business and reply faster to customers' needs and requests. This will reflect positively on his family's socioeconomic situation.

Mohama hopes to keep on developing his business and will work hard to recruit someone to help him when business increases.

loans.use: To buy an important newly released aluminum pressing machine

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Doña Anita es una mujer con 48 años de edad, divorciada y madre de dos varones. Actualmente vive en unión libre con otro compañero y un hijo. Es una clienta muy trabajadora y con visión empresarial. Humilde, simpática y con muchos deseos de crecer y superarse. Se dedica al comercio hace muchos años y ahora solicita por segunda vez un financiamiento a la Fundación para reforzar su negocio. Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia en las decisiones a tomar con respecto a su actividad. Ella vende oro, y también por catálogo, pero ésta vez busca reforzar la actividad de la venta de oro, debido que para ésta época tiene muchos encargos. Su objetivo es trabajar fuerte para generar más ingresos y asi mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y la de su familia.
texts.en: Anita is a 48 year old woman who is divorced and the mother of two young men. She currently lives in a common law marriage with another partner and a child. She is a very hard worker and she has a vision for business. She is humble, friendly and has a lot of desire to grow and to succeed. She has worked on her business for many years and now she is seeking, for the second time, a financing from the Fundación to reinforce her business. She counts on the support of her family when she makes decisions regarding her work. She sells gold, and also items by catalogue, but this time she seeks to reinforce her gold sales business because at this time she has many orders. Her goal is to work hard to obtain more earnings and by this means improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase gold.

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en:
Gaspard, 52 years old, has been a maize farmer for the past three years. He would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to increase his maize production. Gaspard wishes to reinvest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production

loans.name: Santos Medardo

texts.es:
Santos, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos para su tienda, como variedad de bebidas, golosinas, frijoles, maíz, aceite, azúcar, sal, etc., con lo que tendrá variedad de productos para seguir teniendo satisfechos a sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior Santos, fortaleció su tienda adquiriendo variedad de productos con los que aumento sus ventas, tiene mayor rentabilidad, con lo que ha salido de sus deudas y da a su familia mejores oportunidades de desarrollo social y económico.
texts.en:
Santos has decided to apply for a new loan to buy supplies for his store, the goods being a variety of drinks, sweets, beans, corn, oil, sugar, salt and so on, this means that he will have a variety of products to continue satisfying his customers.

With the previous loan, Santos bolstered his store, buying a variety of products with which he increased his sales. He has a better profitability, through which he has got out of debt and gives his family better opportunities for social and economic development.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his store.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 59 years old and from Nyandarua South. She is married and has big children who are all married. 

Rosemary has a boutique that she has been running for many years. She has applied for her second loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy more clothes to add to her stock. 

She hopes to expand her business and be able to open another boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to add to her boutique.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 32 years old and from Naivasha. She is single but supports one child who is seven years old and in school. She has a retail shop that she has been running for many years.

Carol is applying for a 20,000 KES loan, her first from Vision Fund Kenya. The loan will enable her to buy milk, soap, cooking fat, etc. to add to her stock. She hopes to own a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to buy milk, soap, cooking fat, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 48 years old and married with nine children. With two children currently in school, Ofelia works very hard to provide for them.

Ofelia runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, noodles, etc. 

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Ofelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
María, continúa fortaleciendo su venta de tamales, por lo que opta por crédito para comprar leña, maíz, pollo, verduras y aceite, pues son su materia prima para trabajar y seguir teniendo sus ingresos económicos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio, a tener nuevos clientes,una cosecha abundante, aumentar ventas y tener mejores ganancias, con las que cancela las cuotas y mejora su situación familiar. También ha empezado a vender tamales para tener ingresos extras.
texts.en:
María continues to build her tamale sales, which is why she is applying for a loan to buy firewood, corn, chicken, vegetables and oil, since they are the raw materials for her to work and continue having an income.

The previous loan helped her to strengthen her business, to have new customers, an abundant harvest, increase sales and have better earnings, with which she makes her payments and improves her family situation. She has also started selling tamales to have extra income.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, chicken, vegetables and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, se decidió por un nuevo crédito debido a los buenos beneficios que obtiene, en está ocasión comprará flores, listones, espumas florales, globos, que son parte de los materiales que utiliza para realizar el servicio de decoraciones y venta de accesorios para eventos. Ya que esta época de graduaciones escolares sus servicios tienen una mayor demanda.
Con la inversión del capital anterior le ayudo a tener un negocio fortalecido para enfrentar la demanda de sus clientes, sus ingresos han mejorado, su número de clientes a crecido la calidad de vida ha mejorado y sigue luchando por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Luis has decided to apply for a new loan given the good profits he makes. On this occasion, he will buy flowers, ribbons, floral foam and balloons which are some of the materials that he uses for decorations and the sale of accessories for events, as this is the moment of school graduations, demand for his services has increased. 

The investment from the previous loan helped Luis to have a business that was strong in the face of demand from his customers, his sales have risen, the number of customers has grown, his quality of life has improved and he continues to fight to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy flowers, ribbons, floral foam and balloons.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is a resident of the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her husband's name is Jagodish and they have two children: a five-year-old son and two-year-old daughter. Purnima is a homemaker. Instead of working, she has always stayed at home looking after the children. She attended school up to class X (Grade 10). Her husband received education up to class VIII (Grade 8). One of their children, the son, reads in class I ( Grade 1). They have a kachha house (a house made of bamboo, mud and straw).

Purnima's husband works on their own land where he grows seasonal vegetables. The products are sold at the local market. In this way, he earns a livelihood for their family. Despite his hard work, his earnings don't stretch far enough to live. So Purnima has decided to stretch out her helping hands to her husband. She thought of starting potato cultivation on their land. She applied for loan from Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to purchase potato seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc., for cultivating potatoes. As potatoes are in great demand in their local market and in the present time, their hope is that this business will be a lucrative one and will increase their earnings and generate the money they need to support their family.

Purnima's dream is to make a pakka house (concrete-made) with the profit generated. She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes and selling them in the market.

loans.name: Lili

texts.fr: Lili est une jeune femme de 21 ans fiancée, mère de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 1 et 8 ans. deux de ses enfants vont déjà à l'école. Après sa formation, elle ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'elle gère depuis 4ans déjà. Elle souhaiterait acheter un centenaire pour sécuriser son activité parce que son salon est construit avec en planche et aussi améliorer son cadre. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de son enfant, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future.
texts.en:
Lili is a young 21-year-old engaged woman and a mother of three children, who age from one to eight years old. Two of her children are already in school.

After her training, Lili opened a hair salon, which she has already been running now for four years. 

She would like to buy a container to secure her [equipment], because her salon is built with planks. She would also like to improve her salon.

Her goal is to satisfy her customers and earn more.

Earnings from this loan will help her to met her needs, those of her children, and also to save in order to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a container

loans.name: Business Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Business Group. They are from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 3,700,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Isatu is the featured leader of this group. The 34-year-old is married to a businessman, and they have two children. Isatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells food ingredients, including onions, pepper, fish, palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), and margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste). With her share of this loan, she is going to buy food ingredients in bulk, to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients in bulk, to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase sardines, sugar, sweets, milk, cigarettes, candles, books, pens, soaps, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is 24 years old and single from a small village called Tubas near Nablus city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. 

For the past year, Hasan has been working in the small grocery shop his family owns. It is a good business and earns a good income. 

Hasan would like to develop his store and put more products on it, but they don't have enough money for it. 

Hasan took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his store to resell. By taking this loan, the store will be in a better condition, and its productivity will increase.

loans.use: to buy more products for his store to resell.

loans.name: Aganza Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Margu est une commerçante avec une expérience dans les affaires de 15 ans et conseillère d’une Association d’Affaires « Aganza ». La cliente est  senior, âgée de 50 ans, divorcée et mère de 3 enfants dont 1 étudie et 2 autres enfants sont déjà mariés et responsables de leurs foyers. La cliente est vendeuse de poissons. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de l’IMF Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 3 sacs de poissons salés. Elle avait commencé son entreprise dans sa jeunesse avec le fonds reçu de son petit ami. Elle souhaite construire sa maison et scolariser son enfant. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes d’affaires non bancables en leur donnant de crédit sans garantie matérielle, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Margu is a merchant with fifteen years of experience in business and advisor for the "Aganza" group. She is a senior 50-year-old woman, divorced, and a mother of three children. One child goes to school while the other two are already married and responsible for their own households. 

Margu sells fish. Margu started this business when she was younger with money received from her partner. She is seeking a loan with the micro-finance institution Hekima in order to increase her business. She is going to buy three sacs of salted fish. 

Margu would like to build a house and educate her child. She thanks Hekima for their support to businesswomen who lack access to financial services by providing loans without requiring collateral, especially during this time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy three sacs of salted fish

loans.name: Daglio Ulises

texts.es:
Daglio, se dispone a recolectar la cosecha de maíz, por lo que nuevamente está solicitando un nuevo crédito para pagar mano de obra y un maquina desgranadora, lo que le facilitara contar con su producción en menor tiempo y así cumplir con los diferentes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.
Con el capital que se le facilito antes le ayudo a comprar los insumos con los que prepararía la tierra para sembrar maíz, aumento su producción, sus granos son mejor calidad, sus ingresos han mejorado. Su familia se encuentra muy saludable.
texts.en:
Daglio is ready to harvest his corn and so is applying for a new loan to pay for labourers and to buy a machine that separates grain from the rest of the plant. This machine will speed up the production process and Daglio will be able to fulfil the various orders from his customers.

Daglio's previous loan helped him to buy supplies with which he could prepare the earth in order to sow corn.  He increased production, his grains were of a higher quality, and his income has increased.  Daglio's family is in very good health.

loans.use: to pay for labourers and to buy a machine that separates grains from their plants.

loans.name: Humberto Mario

texts.es:
Humberto, se le ha presentado la necesidad de invertir en su negocio por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar ganado para engordarlo y luego venderlo a sus clientes, son está adquisición su negocio estará fortalecido y contara con la satisfacción de sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior compro ganado, lo que le dio la facilidad de fortalecer su negocio, tener más clientes, aumentar sus ventas, y tener mejores ganancias, las cuales han sido utilizadas en cancelar la deuda y mejorar las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Humberto finds himself in need of investment for his business and so is applying for another loan in order to buy cattle to fatten up and sell to his customers.  With this loan, his business will be stronger and Humberto's customers will be satisfied.  

Humberto used his previous loan to buy cattle, which made his business stronger, gave him more customers, and increased his sales and income.  This higher income was used to pay off his debt and to improve his family's circumstances.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Kilombero Group

texts.en:
Joyce, who is in her late thirties, is single with two children who are still at school. She has operated a cosmetics business for three years now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Joyce's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy cosmetics which were in demand and pay off her loan. She used her profits to pay school fees, buy a plot of land and cover household expenses. She is doing fine and really appreciates that loan.

Joyce is applying for a 5,600,000 TZS loan to share with the two other members who comprise her group named Kilombero. The three members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Joyce will use her portion of the loan to buy different types of cosmetics to meet her customer's demands. She dreams of building her own house on the plot of land she bought.

loans.use: to buy different types of cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his motorcycle-taxi.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
María, es acompañada, vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijas, como motivación propia hace mucho tiempo fundo una tienda en su casa, en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad, la atiende de 6:30 a.m. a 8:00 p.m., es apoyada por sus hijas.
Mejorar su inventario con productos nuevos y a buen precio, por lo que solicita capital para comprar jabón, detergentes, pastas, bebidas, golosinas, pan, y granos básicos. Con lo que tendrá un aumento en sus ventas, nuevos clientes y mejores ingresos.
María sueña con tener los recursos económicos para que una de sus hijas culmine su carrera universitaria y también mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María has a partner - she lives with him and her three daughters. María opened a store in her house a long time ago, with her own motivation. María sells basic necessities in her store, working from 6.30am until 8pm. She receives support from her daughters.

María wants to improve her store by offering new stock and so she is applying for a loan in order to buy soap, detergents, pasta, soft drinks, sweets, bread and basic grains. With this loan her sales will increase, and she will have new customers and a higher income.

María dreams of having enough money for one of her daughter's to complete university and also to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergents, pasta, soft drinks, sweets, bread and basic grains.

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es:
María, solicita capital para invertir en la venta de comida ya que en estas fechas  los vacacionistas aumentan y para aprovechar la época surtirá con los insumos necesarios al negocio, comprara carnes, arroz, aceite, chicharrón, quesillo, bebidas  y verduras para continuar elaborando la variedad de comida que ofrece.
María se siente satisfecha con los efectos positivos que tuvo con el préstamo anterior, pues con facilidad fortaleció su negocio  y se ha mantenido vendiendo comida, sus ventas aumentaron y sus ganancias son mejores con las cuales ha cancelado sus cuotas y mejoro el estilo familiar.
texts.en:
María is applying for a loan to invest in food as, during these end of year festivities, sales increase. In order to take advantage of the season, María will stock up on necessary supplies for her business: she will buy meat, rice, oil, pork, cream-cheese tortillas, vegetables and soft drinks.

María is satisfied with the positive results of her previous loan. She was able to strengthen her business and has continued selling food.  Her sales increased and her higher profits allowed her to pay off her loan and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, oil, pork, cream-cheese tortillas, vegetables and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana, es una madre que ha tendido que ingeniárselas para poder a sus tres hijos lo necesario para crecer en un ambiente sano, las edades de sus hijos son 8, 5 años de edad y uno de un mes de nacido, ella es soltera, para obtener los ingresos instalo una pupuseria y venta de antojitos en su residencia, es un oficio que aprendió de su madre, ya cuenta con cinco años de experiencia.
Necesita el crédito para comprar quesillo, chicharrón, harina, aceite, tomates, repollo y aderezos, ya que son su materia prima para trabajar en su negocio, espera tener un servicio, atraer nuevos clientes, aumentar ventas y mejorar su economía.
Anhela aumentar la rentabilidad de su negocio para ofrecer a sus hijos un futuro con mejores oportunidades en su educaión.
texts.en:
Ana is a mother who has had to be inventive in order to give her children everything they need to be able to grow up in a healthy environment.  Ana has three children, the eldest two are eight and five years old each, and the youngest is one month old. Ana is single and in order to earn an income, she has a stall at her home selling stuffed corn tortillas and snacks.  She learned this work from her mother and now has five years of experience.

Ana needs this loan in order to buy tortillas with cream cheese filling, pork, flour, oil, tomatoes, cabbage, and dressing, the basic supplies that she needs to work.  Ana hopes to offer good service, attract new customers, increase her sales, and improve her financial situation.

Ana longs to increase the profitability of her business in order her children a future with better educational opportunities.

loans.use: to buy tortillas with cream cheese filling, pork, flour, oil, tomatoes, cabbage, and dressing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing items for men, women and children.

loans.name: Vitore

texts.en:
Vitore is the divorced mother of a 24-year-old.  Her 28-year-old son passed away about a year ago. With him passing away, she literally struggled, emotionally and financial wise. She did not work for an entire year, because the grief was enormous, according to her.

“I could not stop crying outloud; everywhere and every time. I was devastated. I wanted to die, too. I would spend the entire day at the cemetery, talking to him and taking care of the flowers on his grave. People in my community and my family provided me with adequate emotional help and here I am now trying to move on,” said Vitore.

Vitore has owned a photo shop for the past 18 years and now wants to add some more equipment to it. The shop is located in a town; thus, it has built a large clientele throughout the years.

This loan will be her first one.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her photo shop

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en:
Ramzana lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her family consists of three sons and three daughters. Her husband is a barber by profession. He is an expert in his skills and provides services in his community market. All of his customers appreciate his work. Ramzana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BARC Pakistan for her husband to purchase variety of scissors, a mirror and a revolving chair for the salon. 
She hopes that that loan would be helpful for her husband to work more professionally. 

Ramzana wishes to provide a quality education for her children. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase variety of scissors, a mirror and a revolving chair for salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, vita (a juice drink), pepper, and salt for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy sugar, cooking oil, chicken cuts and salt for resale.

loans.name: Rehan

texts.en:
Rehan is 47 years old. She is a widow and lives with one child in the Baku region. Her husband died of war in Kharabakh.  Today she is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Zangilan city for already 21 years. Her son is studying at the fourth course of college. 

Rehan is a cook.  She makes national dishes like “xingal,” “dusbere,” “eriste,” “gurze,” etc.  

Now she needs a loan amount of AZN 2,300 to buy a new fridge, plates, and dishes. Therefore she has applied to the Komak company for the loan. 

Rehan is thankful to Komak and Kiva organizations for the loan. In the future she wants to improve her business, and in personal life she wants her son to get engaged.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge, plates, and dishes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is the single mother of three children; all her children go to school. She also takes care of her brother's children. 

She has a business of selling fruits and vegetables like sweet bananas, tomatoes, and onions. She has applied for a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of sweet bananas and boxes of tomatoes and onions. She generates additional income from selling charcoal.  

She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis.  Her business challenges includes seasonality and thieves, 

She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler, buying a plot of land to build a house, and also starting to grow some of those vegetables.  

She resides in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of sweet bananas and boxes of tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
Ana, opta por un nuevo crédito para adquirir hilo y pagara hamacas, con lo que elabora más hamacas y cancelará a las hamacas a las personas que le colaboran en esta  actividad, ya que está época del año es cuando las ventas aumentan.
Con el crédito anterior expandió su negocio, aumentaron sus ventas, su economía ha mejorado y le ha permitido cubrir los pagos de sus cuotas y seguir aportando en los gastos familiares. Su familia junto con ella por el momento se encuentra muy saludable.
texts.en:
Ana decided to seek a new loan to buy thread to make more hammocks and to pay for the hammocks that the people working with her in this activity have made, given that this is the time of year in which sales increase.

With the previous loan, she expanded her business, her sales increased, her finances improved and it allowed her to cover her repayments and continue contributing to the family expenses. Together with her family, Ana is in a very healthy situation.

loans.use: to buy threads and pay for hammocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as fabrics, threads, elastics and clothing molds.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married with five children and four of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (father). She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for six years. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income through roasting maize. She works from home six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to becoming a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.  

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because it was reaching out to the bottom poor. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more timber for resale.

loans.name: Vincia Mae

texts.en:
Vincia Mae is 21 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by running a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Vincia Mae has been fattening pigs for two years and earns additional income from a general store.

Vincia Mae is borrowing 9000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Flaubert

texts.en: Flaubert is a thirty-four-year-old Cameroonian. He is married, with two children. The older child is five in primary school, while the younger is two years old. He has been in this business for over six years which makes him very experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will help him to increase his monthly profit by forty percent. His standard of living will also be improved.

loans.use: to buy a better shaver

loans.name: Haruni's Group

texts.en:
Baraka is a group of 7 farmers in Kakamega North District with Haruni selected as the Kiva representative. Haruni has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 64 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Haruni is married and has three children.  He is 39 years old and is known as hardworking. He is active in his community in groups such as the women's group, and prayer group. Haruni has been a farmer for 25 years. Haruni described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  
							
Haruni first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Haruni joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to help more farmers.  Haruni plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Haruni’s own life was improved because he was able to feed the family. 

Haruni and the Baraka Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
	
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Santos Enrique

texts.es:
Santos, está acompañado, vive solo con su compañera de vida, no tiene parientes en el extranjero, se dedica a siembra de granos básicos, realiza sus labores de siembra de maíz y frijol de 6:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m., lo hace de forma independiente y es un oficio que aprendió de su padre. 
Invertirá en la recolección de la cosecha, pagara mozos que le ayuden y el transporte de la cosecha hacia su casa, espera recolectar su cosecha a tiempo y de esa manera tener listos los granos en menor tiempo para ofrecerlos a sus clientes, incrementar sus ganancias con lo que cancelara sus cuotas.
Sueña con mejorar su economía para tener los ingresos necesarios para hacerle reparaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Santos is in a couple, lives only with his life partner, and does not have relations abroad. He makes his living sowing bulk grains; he sows corn and beans from 6 a.m. to 2 p.m., doing this independently and it is a profession he learned from his father.

Santos will invest in the harvesting of the crop; he will hire laborers to help him and to ship the crop to his home. He hopes to collect the produces in time and in this manner have the grains ready in less time to offer to his customers, as well as increase his profits with which he will repay his loan. He dreams of improving his finances to have the income needed to repair his home.

loans.use: to invest in harvesting the crop.

loans.name: Heros

texts.en:
Heros is from Gogaran village of Lori region. He is married and is a father of three little children (his wife and two children are in the photo).

Heros has been involved in an agribusiness for over five years. He keeps livestock: cows, sheep and chickens. He also cultivates wheat, potatoes and grass. Heros is a very hardworking young man who does his best to sustain his family's living conditions. His wife is hardly managing to take care of their three little children so Heros is the only breadwinner of the family. During the winter season Heros also goes to a neighboring country and little by little supports his family financially. 

Heros took a loan from a local financial institution before but wasn't able to pay it back on time, because of the family's poor living conditions. Now, thanks to his tireless and devoted work, Heros is perfectly managing to cover his family's daily needs and successfully runs his farm. With this loan that he is asking for, Heros would like to purchase a cow and five sheep. This loan will help Heros to be ready for the coming winter cold months. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and five sheep.

loans.name: Farmayil

texts.en:
Fermayil is 53 years old and lives in the Baku region. He is married and has three children. His wife is a housewife. Fermayil’s older daughter is married. His son is studying his third course in college and his younger daughter is in seventh grade. 

Fermayil rents a store and sells different toys, including cars, puzzles, and puppets. He loves little children and therefore loves his job. He wants to expand his lovely business and start selling children's clothes. Therefore, he is applying for a 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) loan from Komak. With this loan, he will purchase a variety of baby clothes. 

Fermayil thanks Komak, Kiva, and Kiva lenders for their help. In the future, he wants to provide a better future for his children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of children's clothes to sell at his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy replacement parts and lubricants for his business.

loans.name: Elise

texts.en:
Elise is 34 years old. She is a widow who takes care of four children. They all go to school. She would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production.  She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. 

With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is a 37-year-old married woman from a small village near Gaza city. She lives with her husband and son in a small humble house. For the past three years, Nisreen's husband has been working in a small grocery shop he owns. it is a good business and his shop is located in a very good area in the city. Nisreen and her husband would like to develop their store and put more products on it but they don't have enough money for it. 

Nisreen took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to expand their grocery shop and put up more shelves. By taking this loan, the store will be in a better condition and its productivity will increase.

Nisreen appears in the photo.

loans.use: to expand their grocery shop and put up more shelves.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is from the Isahakyan village, where he lives with his parents. Edgar has become the only breadwinner in his family after his father got retired. Currently he does his best to provide minimum living conditions for his parents. 

Edgar is a farmer. He owns a plot of land where wheat is grown. He also keeps livestock of chickens, pigs and piglets. 

Edgar feels very responsible to take care of the farm, which is the only source of family's income. So by applying for this loan, Edgar asks financial support to purchase two oxen, fertilizer, and seeds for cultivation. 

Since this is the first loan for Edgar, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. 

Edgar hopes that the loan will bring for him a success to enlarge his farm and ensure a better life for his parents.

loans.use: to purchase two oxen, fertilizer, and seeds for cultivation of the land

loans.name: Glenda Marilu

texts.es:
Glenda, vive una casa familiar junto a su hijo y su compañero de vida, en busca de apoyar con los gastos de su familia inicio a trabajar con una amiga, hoy en día tiene un año en el que se dedica a vender ropa y productos de belleza de forma independiente.
Comprará variedad de ropa y productos de belleza, tales como camisas, blusas, trajes y pantalones para damas, caballeros y niños, también adquirirá cremas corporales, labiales, sombras, etc., con lo que su negocio se verá fortalecido para estas temporadas de fin de año, espera aumentar sus ventas, incrementar los ingresos, y salir de sus deudas.
Sueña con mejorar su economía, tener un negocio más amplio, seguir aportando en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Glenda lives in a family home together with her son and life partner. In seeking a manner to help with her family's expenditure, she started to work with a friend. Today she has been selling clothes and beauty products in an independent manner for one year now.

She will buy a variety of clothes and beauty products such as shirts, blouses, suits and trousers for men, women and children. She will also buy body creams, lipsticks, eye shadows and so on, with which to strengthen her business for the end-of-year season. She hopes to increase her sales, grow her sales and get out of her debts. 

She dreams of improving her finances, having a larger business, and continuing to support the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes and beauty products.

loans.name: Agness' Group

texts.en:
Mamboleo is a group of 6  farmers in Chwele District with Agness selected as their Kiva representative.  Agness has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right side of the photo with her hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 61 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Agness is 45 years old and has been a farmer for 13 years. she works as a farmer to provide for her 7 children.  The community and other farmers know Agness as friendly and an experienced.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community, with the women's group and burial committee for example.  Agness described her harvest last year as excellent, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.							

Agness joined One Acre Fund in 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Agness joined One Acre Fund so that she could get  access new farming methods to earn enough to feed family.  Because she is an active community member and wants to help more farmers, Agness has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved her life because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, and was able to save money.  In the future, Agness hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school and invest in a business.
  							
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Agness and the Mamboleo Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	
						
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left side of the photo.

loans.use: to support farmers in purchasing hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase their harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es: María ha trabajado durante los últimos 20 años en su propio negocio, un pequeño quiosco donde ofrece desayunos, almuerzos, alimentos fritos, mecato, gaseosas, entre otros, se encuentra ubicada al lado de un parqueadero de buses, por lo que sus principales clientes son los conductores de la zona, trabaja sola todos los días desde muy temprano en las mañanas, así genera los recursos necesarios para solventar los gastos de su familia, conformada por su esposo y 3 hijos, a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito que será invertido en la compra de insumos al por mayor (verduras, carne, arroz, pollo, gaseosas, mecato, entre otros) y realizar adecuaciones locativas (cambiar el lavaplatos), eso le permitirá tener disponibilidad de materia prima para satisfacer la demanda de sus productos y, además podrá cumplir con todas las exigencias que requieren las autoridades de sanidad, así le podrá dar una mejor imagen a su establecimiento y estará en la capacidad de atraer nuevos clientes. María sueña con poder ampliar su negocio, fortalecerlo y hacerlo crecer para que sea uno de los más reconocidos en la zona y le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
For the past twenty years María has worked in her own business, a small kiosk where she offers breakfast, lunch, fried foods, pastries, soft drinks, etc.  She's located next to a bus station so her main customers are local drivers.  She works alone every day from very early in the morning making the income she needs to pay expenses for the family, which includes her husband and three children whom she has gotten ahead with a great deal of effort

She's currently seeking the support of a loan, which she'll invest in the purchase of wholesale supplies (vegetables, meat, rice, chicken, soft drinks, pastries, etc.) and improvements to her stall (replacing the dishwasher).  This will allow her to have the main items at hand to satisfy demand for her products and to be able to comply with all the health officials' requirements.  She'll also be able to put a better face on her establishment and attract new customers.  María dreams of being able to expand her business, strengthen it, and grow it into one of the best-known in the area, guaranteeing the economic stability needed to provide her family better well-being.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (vegetables, meat, rice, chicken, soft drinks, etc) and to make improvements to her locale (replace the dishwasher).

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old and married to Grace. Together they are blessed with a one-year-old child.

For the past five years Joseph has sold bread and cakes in Naivasha. He obtained a first loan to buy bakery goods to increase his stock. He successfully paid the loan off.

Joseph is now applying for a 60,000 KES loan through VisionFund Kenya to buy more bread and cakes to sell. He hopes to garner great profits from this loan. As for the future, he hopes to prosper in his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more bread and cakes to sell

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 34 years old. He has spent ten years in maize production, and he is requesting a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
David is a member of Amuka Group in Chwele District. He is pictured here in a group of 6 One Acre Fund  farmers. The group is made up of a total of 82 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. David has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving the necessary inputs to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
David is 34 years old and has been a farmer for 15 years. David works as a farmer to provide for his three children. The community and other farmers know David as friendly, hardworking and reliable. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community such as the men's group and the savings group.  David described his harvest last year as not with One Acre Fund, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.							

David is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. David joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get fertilizer, hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, and is an active community member and wants to help more farmers. David plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to save for the future. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  

David and the Amuka Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize, millet and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Rejia

texts.en:
Rejia is a married woman. She is a housewife of 37 years old. Her husband Tazmal is 45 years old. Both of them are illiterate and can only sign their names. They live in the small village of Barosoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri, in their own small kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo).  Rejia is blessed with four sons. All of them go to school. They read in class VIII (grade 8), class VII (grade 7), class VI (grade 6) and class II (grade 2).

Rejia's husband has a small business of selling betel nuts (used as mouth fresheners), which grow on their own land. His earning is not sufficient to cover the household activities and the educational expenses of their children.

Rejia wants to help her husband. She came to know about BJS and has decided to take a loan from them to start a new business of cultivating potatoes, which are in great demand in the present market. She will use the loan to buy potato seeds, fertilizers and manure to start cultivation of potatoes on their own piece of land. She hopes her business will ensure her family members a decent lifestyle; especially so her children will have a better education and a better future.

In the future, she wants to build a pacca house (concrete-made) with the profit she earns from her business.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Jotham

texts.en:
Jotham is a 27-year-old from Nakuru. He is married to Mildred, and they are blessed with one four year old child.

He owns a motorcycle which he uses for public transportation. He has been in this business for three years and earns a monthly income of 5,800 KES.

Jotham has applied for his first loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use his loan to open another business selling charcoal.

He anticipates that he will use his profits to pay back his loan, educate his child, and expand his charcoal business. In the future, he hopes to buy a plot of land, to build houses for rent, and to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to open a charcoal selling business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is thirty years old, unmarried and from Nakuru. For the past ten years he has operated a small retail shop from which he makes a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

After taking out and repaying a first loan through VisionFund Kenya, Moses is now applying for a second loan of 50,000 KES. He plans to use the loan to buy more stock for his shop as well as pay off the loan itself.

As for the future, Moses hopes to buy a plot of land and build houses to rent.
